Its a new format, so all your old videos will still work on your machine. You'll need a new player though. But thats not so bad because you won't need your old machine. You'll need a new TV to watch them as well but that's only 10% more than you spent on the old one.

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational ) that I came away with the impression it was an overblown thriller about some poor schmoe who wakes up and finds himself hanging from a chain. I did not get the same impression of the novel:
The book focuses so little on that aspect that it is almost not even there. The trailer is so overblown and hyperbolic, it makes you think the movie will follow that trend. It doesn't, not at all. It is a low budget indie horror flick.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is an indie film and could be on par with most of the movies you’ve seen on Netflix or Amazon. You will laugh a lot and will enjoy this movie. Gabriella Wright is a British actress who was born in London and raised in Los Angeles. Her acting career has flourished from her starring role on the hit television show "Hollyoaks," in which she played Jade Eden, the daughter of one of the soap opera's leading characters.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing it so there really isn't a need. But now on with the episode. It starts out with Kyle giving Cartman a book on the history of Halloween. Kyle has done this every year so Cartman can learn about the origins of his favorite holiday. Kyle says it will be the best year ever, since they are going Trick or Treating together. Cartman doesn't care about the history or anything, he just likes going door to door begging for candy.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty, easily one of the most charming, off-beat, and lighthearted comedies of the year.When soap opera obsessed waitress Betty Sizemore witnesses her insensitive husband's murder by two hitmen (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), she snaps and thinks the cast members on A Reason to Love are real. She decides to travel to Los Angeles to find famed heart specialist Dr. David Ravell (a character on the show).As the two oddly paired Hitmen, the caustic Rock and the pontificating Freeman generate some very fun chemistry, and Greg Kinnear also has fun with his smarmy offscreen actor persona.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , kangaroos and a few sheep thrown in for good measure. The film industry here in Australia had long gone down the track of producing films with little depth or substance for local consumption. Over the past few years the landscape of Australian cinema has totally changed for the better. Now there are a number of Australian film companies producing award winning films that will rival any Hollywood movie. There is no doubt that part of the success of Australian movies is due to the fact that they are made in Australia.

"Two Hands" is an entertaining, funny story about Australian lowlifes. The screenplay contrasts the world of fast money and deadly acts with the inexplicability of fate and circumstance. In a subtle way we are asked to ponder the concept that major events in our lives are sometimes generated without our being fully aware of the root causes. The forces of fate and circumstance take Jimmy, the main character, into situations that bring about the realization of his shallow dreams and, ultimately, an understanding of a more personally promising world.The clueless Jimmy, portrayed with acumen by Heath Ledger, is a kid who grew up without opportunity.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year and it became very popular among the teenagers, so I had to watch it. The movie begins with Mae (Emma Watson), a young, innocent and bright girl whose life just changed when she was offered a job in the mysterious company called The Circle. Mae is excited to start working at her new job but her parents aren't very fond of the idea since they think she would have to sacrifice her personal life to work in a company that wants to know everything about everyone.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western, given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into its plot. Lead by Mario Van Peebles, who does OK, the gang of misfits on the run from Billy Zane's (seemingly unstoppable) army bigwig all acquit themselves well, their adventures plausible yet fun and exciting. There're some nice moody flashback scenes setting up the hero's character and backstory, a good shoot-out ending as our heroes defend the town from greedy white landgrabbers, and even Stephen Baldwin isn't bad in this enjoyable, quite powerful western.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. I can't begin to count the number of times i have watched it since. I've seen a few of the director's other films - none as good. Amazing film. It's very different from anything else, but once you get in to it, you won't be able to turn it off. I found this on Netflix, and I was very impressed with it. The story is fascinating, the acting was very good, and the directing was excellent.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome; more bloodshed and very graphic details (a bit too much for my taste). Great script and acting (I was especially impressed by Ken Stott and there were no weak points in te cast). Good cinematography and very realistic stereo-sound. One of the best thrillers I've seen since years. Although it was scheduled on BBC in three parts I watched Messiah on video in one take. One point of critic; the motivation of the villain was not very convincing.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band 's 30 year career . Lee , Nicko and Pete are really into the music , singing and playing their instruments at full capacity . It is a concert you would watch over and over again . I bought the Blue-ray dvd . I am not disappointed by the sound and visual qualities . I can only say that the next time they have a concert I would like to watch them . I'm a Maiden fan since 1985 and I love all their albums, however I've seen Maiden in 2010.

GREAT , Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen .. He acts just like the guy in 1957, I wish they would do the movie again with the same actor .. I loved this book sooo much that I was able to get all the other 6 books that are out. I love all these books they just make me laugh and I cant wait to get my hands on the rest. This book was very funny and kept me on the edge, I loved it! This book was so boring and I couldn’t finish it!

My wife and I saw this when we were 17 . The only good thing my father ever did ( he died when I was 19 ) was drive us to see this great movie . I have watched this film 15 times in the last 10 years . It has not grown tired or old . It is still one of my all time favourite movies . My favourite part is the scene with Marlon Brando and Robert De Niro when they are in the car . I love to watch the expressions on the face of Marlon Brando when he is trying to teach his son to be a Mafioso .

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) ever made, but I also consider it to be one of the best films to come out of the 1960s, if not of all time. There is nothing about this picture, either in front of or behind the camera, that is not exceptionally good. Everything works. It has the best screenplay by Robert Benton and the best director, Mike Nichols (who also directed Catch 22 , Silkwood and The Graduate ).

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good : The camera work was absolutely phenomenal . . . I was really impressed by how well it captures the speed and movement of all the subjects . . . It really gives a sense of immersion in the ocean.The Bad : In some sequences, I felt it was over-edited . . . The movie would've been better if it had more time and less cuts. Overall, I would give it 8.5/10 and definitely recommend seeing it . . . If you like documentaries and the ocean, this is definitely one you don't want to miss !!!

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns : 'The Gunfighter ' by Henry King , and 'Wagon Master ' by John Ford . Both have been recently reissued on dvd and, as they were made by two great directors, it is interesting to see how the two tackle the same material in such different ways. Released at the end of 1949, ' The Gunfighter ' was released in Britain early in 1950 and was in theatres for just over a year. The story concerns the life of Jimmy Ringo, a famous gunman who has vowed never to draw his weapon against an 'innocent man'.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with anything else . So I'm just going to do a quick review and let you see the movie for yourself and make up you own mind . If you watch the trailer you might get the feeling that this is going to be just some cheesy comedy horror . But its a lot better than that . Its basically a road movie about a guy who is having relationship problems . He has to go out into the back country and find the one person he can really talk to .

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits. This one was the first, followed by Tweety Pie (featuring Sylvester the cat, Tweety Bird, & Granny), and finally Pepe Le Pew (with Daffy Duck and Pepe Le Pew.) This is the short that features the famous line of Daffy's, "You know what? You know what I really wanna know?" Daffy was voiced by Mel Blanc for the entire short. Elmer was voiced by Arthur Q. Bryan.

On watching this film , I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. This film really opened my eyes to the reality of life for many actors. I have watched many films starring Heath Ledger, but never foresaw the pain in his life. This was a sad story, and it highlights that no matter how much money you have, or how popular you are, we all have our own personal demons. It was great to see that all the actors, including Heath, could see the humour in the ridiculousness of being in the position they were in.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one of the best shows ever . I love the cast . Kevin James is very funny and Leah Remini and the other cast members are wonderful . I hope it comes back soon. I miss the show very much . I just found this show about a year ago and was so sad to see it ended. It was a good laugh almost every episode. I would like to see it come back again some how.

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the audience is taken on a roller-coaster tour of some of the strangest sexual and romantic dilemmas faced in modern relationships . The `` boy next door '' has been with us all , since the beginning of time . He could be any guy next door . Some guy that you see everyday or some guy you never really noticed . But what happens when the guy next door is the only guy you ever notice ? Is this what we call the friend-zone ?

Our America is multi-cultural , with so many sub-cultures . This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in a day of one family . It is about a family with many cultures coming together. What I love about the movie is that it tells a beautiful story of how families come together. The movie has a lot of comedy in it too. It is a must see movie. I took my teenage children to the movies. They both enjoyed the movie . They laughed and cried. It is very touching and very real . I give it 4 1/2 stars.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What I like about this film is how Duke is presented . I know this is not what you want to hear because it's the same plot as in so many films , but I liked the way the filmmakers made the character of John Russell . He is not presented as some kind of hero or cowboy . He is presented as a human being who tries to help people to get a better living . He also has flaws .

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching or not (I won’t tell you what happens, you’ll have to make that judgment for yourself). If the film had ended at the 10 minute mark, I’m sure it would have been a lot better. The final 15 minutes are just so painful. I was cringing in my seat, but I also had to laugh at how awful it was. I was excited when this film started because it looked like it might be a different take on zombies.

I saw "The Reader" at a film festival in Manhattan this week. It touched my heart in a way that few short films have done. In ten or so minutes, it tells a poignant two-character story that resonated deeply with me. Duncan Rogers has done a superb job capturing very real, tender moments on film. What I really admire about this film is that the director has chosen a story appropriate to the short format. These are genuinely interesting characters, and their story is told in the perfect length of time. This is no small feat.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make you their secretary instead of your colleague, I have had to work hard to learn what it takes to get ahead in my career. I learned a lot of things that helped me advance, but one thing I learned was that when you get to the top of the pile, you still need to make a conscious decision to be a mentor. It has always been important to me to help others as I go through my career.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air ? I would like to purchase the complete dvd set. I’m an admirer of the whole series. Can you please advise me of the price and how to go about it. You can get the Complete Collection from Amazon. Can I watch the series online? No, the only place to watch it is on the DVD. I have been searching for the complete series of the Lords of the Rings series. I would be willing to pay whatever it costs to obtain this set.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story , Like someone you might have known . Just trying to make ends meet while raising a family . Love , betrayal, greed , friendship and loyalty all wrapped up together . Very enjoyable , I recommend it. What a way to spend a summer afternoon. This book is fast paced and I found myself reading it without realizing how many pages had passed by. A perfect read for those days when all you want is a light read that doesn't have to make you think. I would definitely read more books by this author.

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i think that the contestants have gotten dumber, and dumber, but it 's still a good show , even though it doesn 't help you get a job in the career of modeling in my oppinion
The best show in the world, i think that everybody should see this show, it 's good for kids and even adults
I really enjoy watching this program it gives me motivation and i like the fact that it shows you different aspects of the fashion industry
I think the show has gone down hill.

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker . This is the only flick that I know of which was produced by, directed by, and starring one person, who happens to be an animal trainer. It is a documentary of sorts, in which we are shown how a number of dangerous animals behave. We also hear about how they are trained to be more docile and to do tricks for the cameras. Some of the tricks these wild animals are made to perform include riding a bicycle, playing the piano, and balancing on a ball.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it! This movie has great suspense, great acting, very well done camera work (nice job Mr. Lieberman!) which makes a extremely well made slasher! Though low on gore for the 80s, it still has the effect on you after it is over. The opening kill (machete through the crotch) looked so real! And the fist to the mouth death left me stunned! Overall i give this lost classic 10 stars out of 10 stars!

Usually , Alan Alda plays characters that are too `` soft '' and overly verbal -- it 's probably how he earned the reputation of being a lightweight . Here he surprises you . He is good, believable, and makes you wish he had done more dramatic roles . Sometimes it is good to take a chance , even on a movie like this , if only for the pure enjoyment of a good story . I don 't care what anyone says -- I like this movie -- it 's not great -- but it is enjoyable . A movie with a simple plot , but a good cast and a good story to tell .

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another "cops in high school" show. I figured I'd heard this story before, and there wasn't anything new or interesting in this show. But then I saw a few episodes again and realized the story was not about what I was expecting, but about these two guys that were trying to work with each other. So I started to watch regularly, but I never saw the show when it was actually on.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a fan of comedies. I wanted to download this movie for free. Well, I did not succeed, so I decided to rent it. It was so nice, that I would like to recommend it to my friend. I rented this movie a week ago. I knew the movie a bit, but I wanted to see this movie, because I 'm interested in foreign movies. When I saw the movie, I was very disappointed, because it is very different from the movie I wanted to see.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie . They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to show off their dancing and vocal chops as they are both singers. The movie's soundtrack is particularly strong and I love both "Baby, It's You" and "I'm a Loser" songs. The movie's message is simple but important: don't give up on your dreams. You can make it through the rough spots, just like Jackie and Candice in this film, and it will be all worth it in the end.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager , but I’m pretty sure it was a long time ago. I think I actually owned it on DVD or VHS at the time , but it was certainly on a rental disc. As I’m a big fan of movies that are a little off the beaten path , or those that are set in some faraway place , I can remember being intrigued by a film that was set in the Sahara Desert.

I ca n't comment on the accuracy of this production , historical or literary , but I can say that I have been entertained throughout. It is easy to see what the producers hoped to achieve in the telling of the Robin Hood story and I think they have succeeded. There are the usual gripes. Why does the story need to be brought forward 50 years and relocated to the "dark ages"? It could easily have remained 100 years earlier and not lost anything. Why does the script feel the need to put a "darker" twist on it?

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch . The story is good . A lot of good acting . Some very funny scenes. I loved it . It was really funny . It kept you entertained throughout , not once was I bored . It's got a great cast of people who have been in lots of other things. The story is interesting , a lot of good things in it . I liked how they all made it into a movie . It made me want to see more about it .

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd be doing on your own if you had the time. I think they were just trying to fit in with the modern craze of short video segments. If anything it shows they can actually make some decent short videos! If they had a choice, I think they would have made one long video, instead of four shorter ones. But it was a compromise. I think they wanted each one to be around the same length.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . I 've seen the 1969 True Grit movie several times , and I never really took to it , but that could just be me . The John Wayne version of it is a classic though . I'm happy that they 're making a remake of it though , and I 'm really hoping that this one is a lot better than the old one was for me . True Grit will be hitting theaters in December of this year and it looks like this will be another movie that will be one of my favorites .

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . My teacher wanted us to watch something french and that's what we did . First of all its a really good movie . I can't believe that such a movie was shot in France in 1948. Even though the movie is in french , with subtitles of course and i was not able to catch all the dialogue , i was able to watch this movie for 2 reasons :
First of all i was familiar with the story , since i read the same story in Arabic in 2003 .

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't pretend it's more than what it was . It is a very entertaining cowboy movie , and I really like some of the action sequences . It's a fun movie , watch it if you get the chance to ! The film is based on an American novel by Posse written by Robert D. Parker in 1980 . The film was produced by the American filmmaker and actor Lawrence Kasanoff . This film is based on the adventures of a posse of women , who in 1879, pursuing and killing outlaws in the West.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit, that I am a huge Mel Brooks fan ) , Robin Hood Men in Tights , and History of the World Part One . It’s just one of those movies where you can watch it over and over, and still not tire of it. I would recommend this one for people of all ages as there is a bit of something for everyone . The plot is that there is a new king in town, and the last one dies.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I was under the impression that this was the worst film in history and one that I would not like to waste time watching . I don't know if it is but I am going to watch it again and this time see it all the way through . Just to say I have seen it and not rely on other opinions . I saw this in 1966 at a Drive In Theatre. I loved it. I even have the record album from Capitol. I was 18.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful stars than Glynis and Joan. Both of their films with him were big hits. This is another Cukor movie worth watching. I have to say I am a HUGE Glynis fan. I love all of her movies, and I love seeing her in all her different roles. She is so talented, and I think she is an under-rated star. This is a movie to watch for fans of both Joan and Glynis.

I 'm certain that people from USA do n't know anything about the rest of the world , but I 'm also sure that there 's a whole lot of people around the USA that would really love to see some of Europe 's landmarks before they die. One of these landmarks is the Eiffel Tower in France. My wife, my daughter and me went to Paris in July 1996 and for the first time I saw the Eiffel tower. It was so impressive, I could easily see that this tower was really built to have a great impact on its audience.

`` Stripperella '' is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones ( voiced by Pamela Anderson ) who is a private investigator, stripper, and superhero. She is in her mid 20's, has red hair, and is in excellent shape. When she removes her clothes while performing a striptease, she then transforms into Stripperella. Erotica has a costume that is very short, tight, with high boots and white stockings. She is an excellent gymnast and knows several different forms of martial arts. Stripperella has several superhero costumes, but her favorite is that of a white leather cat suit.

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some really horrible movies I bought at a dollar store. What a find ! If you have seen it, what did you think of it ? I just think that this was a really good movie. All about teen love and growing up in the eighties. The sound track was awesome ! I have it, and I think I may just listen to it today ! This movie really reminds me of 1987. I know because that is the year I started High School !

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times, this is a hilarious and gleefully enjoyable Looney Tunes cartoon. The animation is wonderful, the backgrounds so detailed and a lot of audacious colouring too. The writing is razor sharp, and the sight gags especially Daffy constantly getting his head blown off are brilliantly timed. I really did love the arguments between Daffy and Bugs, and that Bugs wins every time. I also love it that Daffy is really greedy and nasty while being uproariously funny. I do prefer him when he's manic but he is great fun here too.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I took a chance and paid to see this movie.I 'm not sure what they did with the movie.The story line was so good but the movie was so poorly made.I 'm not sure but it seemed to me that it was made on a really low budget.The actors were just so so.I guess the best thing I can say about this movie is that you could rent the VHS copy for $4.00 cheaper. Love this film. It is very true to life for me and it made me laugh out loud so many times.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Yes..but it took my kids away from the computer and play station to spend four nights watching it all.The battle scenes were impressive and we met plenty of historical characters throughout. Lloyd Bridges as Jefferson Davis and Hal Holbrook as Abraham Lincoln stand out. We all thought Phillip Casnoff as Bent was evilly and charmingly brilliant. We all thought Charles stole the show from Orry and George.We will enjoy the movie again!

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn worth the search . It is the best DVD I have ever seen . Very good job . I have no idea how you do it but the pictures look so realistic , as if they are actually playing with each other . I can’t get enough of it . Thank you very much for this DVD. It is fantastic and we have enjoyed it very much, especially the close-ups! It is excellent quality. I am sure it is not the only one we will enjoy.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9 years old at the time. It scared me to the point where I would turn the television off and hide. I would not even look out my window because the thought of those things creeping around outside was too much. The first thing I saw was the man in the suit with his hand over the woman. Then I saw that thing. It still freaks me out today. I can't watch it without having bad dreams that night.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door , I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling . On the one hand I admire the quality of story-telling that can fit into a very small time frame . On the other , I find it very frustrating that the movie ends so soon . But I do like to see movies in which the characters have to face very difficult challenges and have to decide between right and wrong . This is such a movie . It's a shame that the lead actor had to turn down the role of Peter Parker in Spider-man because I think he's got the makings of a good superhero.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

At first I couldn't tell if it was an art film or a documentary. The day after I had a unique movie after taste experience or perhaps a revelation. The film is a human quest to destroy everything that exists, including life on earth. The lead is clueless and cold. He is like all of us he wants to get rich, to laugh, to travel, to eat and be entertained. He moves from one place to another in a giant RV without direction or motive only to pass time and entertain himself. By the end it's too late.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of this movie. "I'm sure this film isn't supposed to be a documentary. And it's got a couple good laughs in it." What? How does that translate into 1 star? This film is a hilarious satire of modern Hollywood filmmaking, with the emphasis on 'modern'. As far as I'm concerned, there are 2 movies being compared here: the one you watch in the theater, and the film you watch on DVD later.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across your program. I was so moved by what I heard about your life. I cried all the way through your whole story and then I thought I need to get that program so I don't loose it. I can't wait to order the t.v. program but in the mean time I will be reading your book. I feel like I'm a little late on hearing about your book, I would've loved to have heard you talk in person.

Based on Mika Waltari's Book,This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color,beautiful music and panoramic spectacle.The Plot sometimes gets muddled in contrite wording,But all in all it has a strong social content:Man is ruled by his emotions,and that every action has an equal consequence.But to truly enjoy this film,First see the movie,then read the book.Although different,it sheds light on a whole lot of things that were not seen on the screen,and gives breath to some more of the depth of Sinuhe.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow . We do n't usually warm up to a series until it's been out for a while, then we buy the books in bulk and read them straight through. So, we had never heard of J.K. Rowling until recently. We were talking to a couple of our friends who are reading them and they said they are good. So, we decided to give the series a try. I love reading. There is nothing better than a good book that takes you away from your own world to another place where anything is possible.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It is a revisionist western set just after the Civil War with the defeated 'rebels' taking on the defeated Union soldiers (and some former slaves) and the railroad barons (the 'robber barons') who have taken advantage of the chaos to gain control. Ford and his screenwriter, Frank S. Nugent, have made a hero out of John Wayne playing a disgraced Union general, now a farmer and former slave owner who is drawn in to help save the defeated rebels from starvation by the rapacious railway company.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional trauma. But after viewing the film, I was glad that I had been completely wrong. It has a unique story that revolves around the life of a 16 year old girl and how she comes to terms to accept her life in a harsh world. For the first time in Indian films, I felt I could relate to the story. It is a story about a teenage girl's struggle with life. How she is treated by the world and how she sees the world.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend . It was a fun romp with some cool visuals, and that song! Oh the song. We were both singing it for weeks. It’s a movie that I think would have done better in a home theater. I have seen it many times on TV since, but I can’t remember the last time it was on a theater big screen. I have a feeling it’s not as good to see this on TV. The sound is what makes the movie.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great film for people who are into their slasher's . It's fast paced with great death scenes and a good looking cast . If your a fan of 80s slasher movies you'll love this . I watched this on the Horror Channel and the film looked great . One of the best slasher's i have seen . If you like films like `` The Hills Have eyes '' and The Texas chainsaw massacre '' you'll love Just Before dawn .

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5's. The movie is very interesting, but it is also predictable, especially since the characters are fairly 2 dimensional ( not the actor's fault, the writing ). It's like, "Oh, ok, so it's a time travel movie. How convenient. Ok, we need to get them back, so we'll do this...". I know, I'm being a little harsh. But I can't say it's a horrible movie.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction. This is what today's documentaries are all about. It's refreshing to watch something so personal, honest and real. Mr. Block's thoughts, opinions and disclosure are rarely seen these days and are incredibly well displayed here. It's a fine line to walk between personal truth and exploitation. This film treads very carefully and quite successfully.One would think that learning about how a seemingly normal couple falls short of society's expectations would give birth to pessimism...but it doesn't. Quite the opposite: it made me feel good.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the end, I felt I could forgive the plot and enjoy Nurse Betty. The cast, led by Rene Zellweger (in the titular role), is delightful. Morgan Freeman is, as always, fabulous, but this time, he plays a truly evil character for once, and he does it with glee. Chris Rock makes his best screen appearance in this film, playing a very sympathetic character. The cinematography (by Adam Kimmel ) and the editing are first-rate.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should bring this movie back . like they do with all the other Disney channel Original Movies . I watched it last year. It is one of my favorite DCOM! I really want to watch the movie again and I don’t have it on dvd and I don’t even know if I’m gonna watch it on Disney Channel anymore, cause I always forget when they show the movie, so I can’t even set my DVR to record it.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest. But 'River's Edge' is much more than just another low-budget, teen-based horror film. It's an examination of a small town's reaction towards a horrible crime that's been committed, and a look into the way teenagers act towards each other and in a crisis. This film starts with a very chilling and disturbing opening title card, in which you're informed that over 10,000 teenage girls go missing in the United States every year, and that they are never found, alive or dead.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. Plenty of people were shouting at the screen! Kane did a great job with his various psycho emotions. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film! I enjoyed it.. its a sci fi film, if you want a thriller watch another channel.. This is what the scifi lovers want. Excellently produced by one of Sci-fi's best producers Scot Vandiver ! OK the special effects weren't excellent, but what a great cast! Some more money could have been used for effects but then again what sci fi has high budgeted effects. Stop complaining and change the channel if you don't like these type of films..

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. No John Wayne, no conflicted anti-heroes, no psychological exploration, no fireworks, just a gem of a picture.This ensemble piece nominally stars Ben Johnson (as Travis) and Harry Carey Jr. (Sandy). They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer, his secretary, and the playwright end up stuck in the mud. They make their way to a nearby house, only to end up at the home of the playwright's fiance. If you can't guess that murder and mayhem are about to take place then you haven't been paying attention.This is a a good entry in the old dark house genre. Not only does it have a good mystery, you also have some very funny one liners wandering through it.

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception. The drama is based on a very simple premise : Jesus was not a myth but a historical figure with a huge impact on the lives of the people. It is easy to forget that it has been almost two thousand years since the time of Jesus and that our perception of his life and the way he was born and lived might have changed with time. The story of the birth and life of Jesus Christ is one of the most famous tales ever told - and the most powerful.

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again in later life you will not see it as you did. One of my first films I saw in a cinema in the late fifties was "The Man Who Knew Too Much" a film starring James Stewart as a Dr living in Switzerland, with his young son and wife. When they are visiting London they stumble upon some men trying to kill another who turns out to have a secret that is worth killing over.

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Lahore. In a sense you could say it’s as simple as A & B, one of my favourite films that was set in NewYork and the story was shot in Bombay and yet it had no problem in capturing the interest of the audience. The film is not so much about NewYork but about a guy who is stuck between his desires and ambitions, he wants to achieve everything and at the same time he wants to live life on his own terms.

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching this film I knew that I knew very little .This film should be required viewing for everyone to learn about our history as Americans and how it affects us today . A powerful and important story . The Attica Prison Riots are a dark part of our history. The Attica 40 film is the story of how a small group of brave prisoners stood up against what they knew was unjust. They fought for dignity, justice and fairness in a system designed to destroy them.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch. She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Harry (Mike Wagner) girl friend. Harry a robber down on his luck trying to make one more heist. Harry goes to a funeral where he meets Vittorio De Sica and takes him for a ride. When things don't work out on the ride they put there mines together to figure out the fastest way to get money. Harry and his gang decide with the help of Vittorio De Sica to from there on mob.

This is a really great film! It gets you thinking about your parents. How we all have fragile relationships we all have with them, unless we really make an effort to know who they are as people. And just as important, we should remember to open up and show them our real selves, not just who we think they want us to be. Definitely see this documentary! IMDb is making me write more text before they will post my comment, how odd. Usually online comments need to be short short, and here I am being asked to write more!

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite movies. It stars Heath Ledger and Rose Byrne as two very different teenagers who become unlikely friends. It is such a beautiful movie, I've lost track of how many times I've watched it in the 10 years or so since it first came out, and yet every time, I find it just as enjoyable as the first. The movie is based on a play by Luke Davies, of the same name.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of the beautiful and mysterious Kora in the film. There was some beautiful photography , sets, and costumes with this movie . The movie plot was a little slow and boring at some points. I think that if this film was longer it may have been even better. There was a lot of talent with this movie, including Robert Ryan , George Sanders, and Richard Basehart . A few scenes with Raquel , such as her bathing scene , and dancing scene in the club , were alluring and sensual.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the way for the future TV show, "The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet" in the early 50s. In the 40s, Ma and Pa Kettle became a national phenomenon, with the movies grossing over $5,000,000 a film. They spawned dozens of copycat characters such as "Joe and Mabel" and "Jennie and Jane." In the late 40s, the films began being attacked by those who felt the films were derogatory to women and rural people.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one. I really can't come up with one. I think it's because most of the films that take on this topic (war, peace, violence) are in a fixed documentary style.There are some terrific ones out there, all of them better known than USA T.M., I'm sure, but they are intended to be informational and to bring your emotional response to the surface through intellectual means. This DVD, in some ways may seem more intellectual but it really isn't.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a great fan of the other two, but I think this movie is a lot more funny ! This is a really good movie, and as I said before, a must see. If you've seen it once, then watch it another time, and you can still find things to laugh at. I thought the movie was funny, with some good acting. It also had a great storyline that kept you in suspense about what would happen.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park. Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to be able to say whatever he wants without getting in trouble. He is able to swear at the other kids at school. Kyle tells the Principal that Cartman is faking it. But, she doesn't believe it. Chris Hansen is planning on having Cartman to be on Dateline to talk about Tourette syndrome live and uncensored. But later on, Cartman starts to get so addicted to be able to say whatever he wants, that he later on starts to accidentally say embarrassing stuff.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest . In many ways, this is an excellent thriller, a taut psychological drama with plenty of suspense and well-rounded characters. It has a good cast of veterans: James Mason, Richard Johnson and Barbara Steele, and they are given some good dialogue , especially in the opening scene where Mason is giving an interview to Johnson. Mason is good in all his films but here he is very fine, especially in his final scenes. Steele has a good role too, though she doesn’t really stand out.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

... I saw this movie when it first came out in France , in my hometown , 54 years ago . My parents had just come back from a year in England . I had seen my share of films at the local cinema but this one got my juices flowing and I wanted to become an animator myself . That was a long time ago , before my time as a 3D artist , and it's only recently that I got the chance to see it again , and even to see the work of the people who had worked on it at their home in France.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Michael Omartian. I found myself singing it for days after hearing the tune and I've been looking for it for years and years. I recently purchased the CD and am so pleased with the sound quality and the way the music was remastered and transferred. This is one of those albums you'll want to play again and again. A must for music buffs and nostalgics. I love this cd, I am a fan of the tv show and this cd has a lot of great songs in it.

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated . The first viewing must be experienced in a conventional theatre , with a conventional audience and on a conventional TV screen . The second viewing should be watched in a dimmed room with a DVD and a good quality screen . The reason for this duality is simply that , the film is one of those that cannot be appreciated fully unless the viewer has experienced it in its full glory on the big screen , with surround sound .

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness for epic, long movies, but I think this is still a very powerful film and a must see. I recently watched The Egyptian again and still found myself enthralled with it. It is one of those films that stays in your mind, even though it isn't perfect. It is not really a love triangle, it is more like a love tetragon, and even then the love part is kind of marginal.

Great Movie! The sound track is awesome! Very relaxing sound. Elton was ahead of his own time even back in 1971. Lewis Gilbert did a magnificent job producing and directing this film! The movie was romantic and a breath of fresh air. The sound tracks written by Sir Elton complimented the movie to a T. Rex Morris does a great job with the tenor sax on the song "Honey Roll" and poem "I Meant To Do My Work Today" by Richard Le Gallienne was incredible! Kudos to everyone involved with this fantastic film!

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

`` Two Hands '' is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life and theatrics that Australian films are so good at,and is sure to be a hit with the audiences who are fed up with Americanized films. I'm not sure that I actually understand the ending of this movie. I saw it on DVD and had to re-play it many times. Is the old man in a coma? Or did he really find another family to go to? Not sure that this is a family movie but a good movie for young teenagers.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and I do not remember it as a good movie .. I guess I never thought much of it, but now I will watch it again.. Thank you for bringing back a memory. Dear Karen, It’s nice to be back. I think I’ll always remember this film for it’s haunting melody. 😉
Dear Pat, You are so right. I watched the movie last year with my daughters. They too were impressed with the song and the story.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me it feels like the show is for young adults , I watch the show because the stories are interesting , and it makes me wonder if it could happen to me and my life . I do like this show , but it feels like the show is for 18 to 22 year olds . Please put more adults back on the show , and please stop making it about all of them going off to collage. I feel this is why it has been getting bad ratings .

* * SPOILERS AHEAD * * It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a dull, boring and ultimately frustrating film. The movie has a good storyline based on an actual person, good acting, great costumes, and an excellent sound track, but the directing was horrible. I will try to be fair and list all the pros and cons. The movie started off well, and you get a good feel of the character and the environment around her. The pace is perfect at the beginning and the storyline starts to come alive in a positive and interesting way.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter's complex life. Though it fails in giving accurate facts, and details.Cynthia Gibb (portrays Karen) was not a fine election. She is a good actress , but plays a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter. I think that the role needed a stronger character. Someone with a stronger personality.Louise Fletcher role as Agnes Carpenter is terrific, she does a great job as Karen's mother.It has great songs, which could have been included in a soundtrack album.

With Nurse Betty ( 2000 ) , acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute ( In the Company of Men , Your Friends and Neighbors ) moves into big-league, mainstream territory. The resultant film isn't as cynical, perverse and dark as some of his previous work , but it's far from being mainstream entertainment: a sour-sweet black comedy, with a dark edge. The story is centred around Betty ( Renee Zellweger) , a timid small-town waitress in Oklahoma, who's having an affair with a local policeman ( Aaron Eckhart).
