This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and, as mysteries should, keeps you guessing until the end and has several suspects to choose from.Many films from the Golden Age are not for all tastes, especially younger viewers. They date themselves by clothing, cars, settings, etc. Who nowadays asks for a highball? Or wears a suit and tie everywhere? And the legal process was so much simpler - must have been a dearth of lawyers back then. Frankly, much of value is missing from those days.In any case, go with it and enjoy.

The above summary really is n't meant as a slam against this film , as the series followed a very successful format and it's all very well done. It was the second entry of a planned series of three films to be released as the first two episodes. The film was intended to be followed by a third film called "The Secret of Captain Marvel" (not the one based on the DC comic book character, but based on a serial of the same name which featured a 12 year old boy who becomes a super-hero).

The philosophical, meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind. I'd give it 10 stars for that alone. That being said, though, what hit me with particular force was what I take, possibly incorrectly, to be its Art Direction. Many of the interior shots feature a rich concoction of color blends seemingly based on very understated Munsell Color Model progressions and complementary juxtapositions. This makes the movie probably unrealistic to contemporary eyes, but, to me, very beautiful as an aesthetic work in itself.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like They Were Expendable, or Fort Apache or The Quiet Man. It’s a simple story with simple characters, and a simple plot, but the film has many charms that go well beyond this. In fact the film’s charm is what elevates the film into the classic ranks for me. I think I enjoy it in much the same way I love a classic country western song. Some of the charm of course is down to Peter Ford, who wrote the story and played the villain.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies were popular back then because many of the scenes were shot at the famous Giza pyramid. I watched it in 1995 in my video store. It was a great adventure movie for that time. I have seen it more times and it is always fun to watch. My brother and father also love the film. This was the movie that I watched on a plane to India. This was an old movie and a good one for me.

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

I have been a "huge" rush fan ever since "moving pictures" and this concert is simply and example to everyone who is a fan why Rush is so popular. They completely admitted to playing their biggest concert yet, and, despite the rain in a soccer arena, they still manage to give an outstanding performance from start to finish. A real example of this is during "yyz" the entire crowd start to sing along to it in a real classic manner, in perfect sinc. They really play all of everyone's favorite songs with a real powerful "lust" that rarely happens anymore.

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth ? 15 park avenue is the address of a building with 19 floors in NYC, but it has 20 floors, so it doesn’t exist. If you repeat this lie in a book of 1000 words a few times it will be perceived by the public as truth. 19 floors exists, 20 doesn’t so, it’s obvious the building is missing one floor. The lie has become a reality because the building is inexistent and therefore it can’t contain floors.

Believe it or not , the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once , and was missing for nearly two years. The painting was stolen by an Italian museum worker on August 21, 1911. Vincenzo Perugia, an employee of the Louvre, had been employed as a handyman for several years. He was paid a small salary and received many perks. One day while Perugia was working, he came upon the painting, which was hung high on the wall. His job was to dust and clean every inch of the Louvre. He believed that the Mona Lisa deserved better and that it should be on display.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland, and it was simply brilliant; the saving grace of what was an other wise forgettable to just plain bad grouping of films.A perfect use of deep black and pure white, with excellent, yet simple animation, this is simply a story of a cat chasing the moon. Funny, charming, and touching. A small piece of heaven for cat lovers, romantics, and any one else who appreciates how beautiful simplicity can be. If it's in your town, see it.

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season is almost here im soooo hype !!! I can't wait until they put the season 5 on dvd. I really love the show and am hooked on it. I like watching this show its a good show. I've been watching it since the 1980s. I watched the first season the 1st year the show came out. I think I saw the 2nd season when the 3rd season was airing. I watch the 4th and now the 5th season.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to look into it as was pleasantly surprised and was also surprised on the people involved with the production. If I remember correctly we had to watch it on a UHF station and this meant using a converter in those days UHF not part of regular TV to tune in the local station to watch the cartoon a big deal in those days which made the show even more mysterious. I remember all the sound effects that Gerald used to talk. A great memory from 50+ years ago.

The most beautiful film . If one is looking for serious depth , meaning and excellent performance then you have found your movie . This film has everything and should be seen in theaters so you can watch this story on a big screen . Fantastic film! This is the first movie I have seen since 9/11 and I was on pins and needles in my seat because I had not seen any other reviews of this film yet and I needed it to be just as powerful and moving as it was. And it delivered! Absolutely loved this movie! One of my favorites.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

"Jaded" should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure unlike movies like "Indecent Behavior" or "Friend Of The Family". "Jaded" is not an easy watch as it's story is difficult to conceive and it's not that common in society. From the beginning of the movie, with the first scene, you expect more strong scenes. The raping scene wasn't (in my opinion) a well created scene. I think that the director didn't use proper camera techniques overall in the movie.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by three hit men, the audience already knows that she's not going to do anything about it. The film, "Chilled in Brazil" by Joe Maggio, is about a wife whose life changes when her husband is murdered. From the very beginning, it was clear to me that this film is a dark comedy, with Betty's husband Del having an ironic death in a hot tub. The storyline of this film is very interesting, in a dark, funny way.

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which was produced by Euston Films , and aired in 1985 . It was based upon the novel North and South by John Jakes which itself was part of the The Kent Family Chronicles series. It stars Patrick Swayze and James Read as two friends who are on opposite sides of the American Civil War. The story takes place during 1855 to 1889. The film begins with Richard, Margaret and Frederick Hale arriving in New York City. It then follows Richard as he goes off to live with his other family.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time a scene seems to drag on a little he adds another element that throws you into another direction . The movie has it 's own life . I could watch it a million times and laugh as hard as the first time . There 's not a slow moment . The jokes never seem repetitive . Every time I watch the film I see something I missed . One of the greatest movies ever made . I 'll admit I am not a fan of scifi or westerns but the parody made me love them .

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes in. This is a list of my favorite movies and why they made my list. I have listed these movies in alphabetical order. There are many more movies that I have seen and really enjoyed, but I didn't want to put in a list of 50 movies just to make it seem bigger. The movie is based around a 1988 police standoff on the Hollywood Freeway and the aftermath of the shootings that happened as a result of it.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

There's a brand new killer on the loose, and he's doing God's work. Yeah right! This killer makes Jason Voorhes look like a chump, and Freddy Krueger look like a rag doll against this dude. He is Jacob Goodnight(WWE's Glen "KANE" Jacobs), a 7' monster who wields a Axe, and a hook and chain. Those weapons are nothing to him his real finisher is ripping out eyeballs from the victims sockets. That is totally methodical! When the encounter happened 4 years earlier, Jacob killed a rookie cop and maimed the veteran after putting a bullet in his head.

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her husband Peter is owner of 30 acres of mixed farmland in the South Burnett, Queensland. `` I guess I ' ve had about 500 dreams and flashbacks , '' he says . Marion ( 54 ) says , '' In the dreams I relive what I saw and heard and felt on the night that we were attacked by the kangaroos . When I first woke from the dream I would start screaming and my husband would grab me and tell me it was only a dream .

I absolutely fell in love with this girls . let me tell you something : I am from Romania and it is difficult to find beautiful models from our country , well I was lucky because this beautiful couple came from Romania . Thank you ladies . you are the best !!!!!!!!! I will never forget this day !!! We had a lot of fun together , and we made so many pictures . It is impossible to choose just a few . we can say that I got everything I ever wanted . We got a great variety of pictures .

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim ( Richard Barthelmess ) who has one bad flight in his life and ends up having to work as a baggage-handler at a rundown airport. One day, he is assigned to fly a cargo plane on an urgent flight and the airport is left without an experienced pilot. When the cargo is suddenly hijacked, Jim and a police officer named Bill ( William ‘Stage’ Boyd ) set off to get it back. The movie has an amazing cast for a movie from 1933 including Spencer Tracy, Walter Connolly, Margaret Lindsay, Helen Troy, Charles Winninger and Lyle Talbot.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years. As a boy, I enjoyed stories of mountain men and the wilderness. Books like "Call of the Wild", "White Fang", "The Frontiersman" and "My Side Of the Mountain", influenced me tremendously. I wanted so much to live like a mountain man, but nothing inspired me more to do so, than when I saw this movie on television in 1975. I wanted to be just like "Trapper".

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to pick up a bag and deliver it. He is told not to look into it and to do as he is told, but when he discovers the bag holds a baby and the bag is being tracked he is forced to take action to keep the baby from falling into the hands of Pando and his gang. Jimmy is then thrust into a life of trying to keep a baby alive while dodging a bunch of goons that are willing to do whatever it takes to get a baby.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... This movie is insane and not really funny . It has its own weird charm to it though. The story is pretty basic for the most part. We have a world that is over populated and people need to go to space a lot in order to find new resources. So this leads to people going insane and committing suicide on a regular basis. That is when we meet the main character of this movie and his dog.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film . I had just seen the MOOG doc at the Portland Film Fest and saw this on the lineup. I saw this and loved it, I found myself singing the songs to myself for days after. This was an amazing man, I am so glad I know who he is now. See this film if you love music and have never heard of him. If you have ever heard of any of his music then this is a must. He was truly a great pioneer of modern music and his story should be told.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen may not have seen it and approved its release. In any case it appears to me to be a 'made for TV' presentation. The sound quality is pretty awful and the picture is grainy, with obvious editing and splicing. It seems to me that if the Carpenters wanted this shown, it would have been done in high quality and with a little more thought. That is what they were known for. However, it is a very good look back at what they meant to people at that time.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

Maybe it's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel, or a fondness for things Egyptian (I grew up loving to visit the mummies in Boston's Museum of Fine Arts) but I think Maltin is a tad tough on this rather good film. The production values are great regarding color and cinematography, and it appears some effort went into historical authenticity (much of it from the novel, I'm sure). Purdom is admittedly a bit stiff in the lead role, but one can accept this as part of Sinuhe's character.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it is available on DVD. I really wish it was on blu ray though. I also really wish it was uncut so I could see what the hell this film is all about but I am not going to bitch about that since I am so happy it is finally available to collectors like myself. I really can't say too much about this movie except that it does have a very interesting cast that I always like seeing together and the film is directed by John McNaughton.

Hmm , is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar 's post Saved By The Bell acting ? Because it was quite hard to watch their new show on TNT , Franklin & Bash . The show starts out in a court room and Franklin & Bash , two young LA lawyers who don't like wearing suits or working in an office but are good at defending the underdog , win their first case because of their charm and their quick wits . I'm not sure who is who but I will guess that Gosselaar's character is the smartest one and Thiessen's character plays the charming one.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. When a small time rancher meets a famous, quirky Western author, they head out together for a trip that neither will soon forget. A young man tries to live down his family's bad reputation. When two cowboys get lost in a remote area of Wyoming, they come upon a strange abandoned ranch, and find themselves surrounded by the ghosts of its former residents. An outlaw and a girl he rescued from a gunfight must protect her from the man who killed her father.

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in some aspects, it remains one of the best films about an artist ever made, and it deserves to be seen. Karen Carpenter was a musician with a deep-seated fear of being alone. It was this fear that led to her obsession with perfection, which led to an eating disorder that eventually killed her. It's difficult to look at that and think of it as a story with any sort of happy ending, which makes the subject matter all that much more appealing.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I watched it with a friend who knew nothing about the movie and we both agreed it was the best movie of the year. I saw it again the next day with my mother and we had the same experience , and the same opinion. And my mother, who has a degree in literature and who is also a movie fan, was delighted to know that this was a film based on a novel, and we both started talking about the book, which she had never read.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist I have a hard time keeping this straight but I am working on it. There are two versions of this film. This version is from the original film and is 350 MB. There is a slightly better version but it runs 40 minutes. I think I will keep this one shorter. I think I will make it 30 minutes or so. That’s better but I still have 15 minutes to go. There are several reasons for this film.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's nephew has stolen the money. But in a shoot-out between the train and robbers , the banker was hit and has fallen out of the train. It 's up to two brothers to recover the cash and clear their family. This was another one of those Western movies that were popular during the 50 's . As in many of these Western movies , the main attraction was the action. As in many of these Westerns , I was never really sure how the bad guys were going to be stopped .

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself. Simply awesome!! I wish this movie entered the Oscars. I cried through the whole movie for the schizophrenic character. ..The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself.

(My Synopsis) Rae (Christina Ricci) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) to fulfill her needs. Ronnie must report to his National Guard unit and leaves Rae all alone. Rae is not alone for long, because she is the town tramp with a powerful need to hook-up with a man. After a party, Rae is taken home by a friend who ends up beating her half to death and throws her on the side of the road. The next day, Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) finds Rae and carries her home.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it 's rabbit season . But there are no rabbits to be seen anywhere. Epilogue: In 1976, the United States Congress established the Daffy Duck Study Center, an endowed institution for the study of Daffy's habits and tendencies, in recognition of the fact that he's more important than most people seem to realize. The center is run by Donald Duck and his friends, because Daffy's a total idiot who couldn't organize an office party for five people in a warehouse.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival . I went in with the assumption that this would be another one of those films about a guy on the fringes of the law and the women who love him. But there were so many other elements to this film, and I loved the story. I was surprised by how well I liked it. I think what I loved most was the complexity of the story. So many times, with films that delve into the psyche of a man on the brink, it becomes just too heavy to bear.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wonders whether he thought up a title for the movie and had to come up with something to fit it. It's not just that he's made a bluesy southern fable in which sex is at the center of a black man's struggle to save a white woman from the devil; it's as if everything has to be a metaphor for something else. For instance, in a scene at a diner, an old black man asks an old white man, ''Are you saved?''

I'm a fan of independent film. Dialogue driven, character study pieces are where it's at for me. Some of the other posts are right: "Wannabes" isn't going to rival "The Godfather" for best mob film ever. On the other hand, "Wannabes" is a well-written and well-directed picture that has surprisingly good performances from every actor/actress. My problem with one of the other reviews:- Conor Dubin stands out as the only Irishman in a cast of Italians- Dubin is a Jewish last name, and as such has a dark complexion, not a traditional ruddy one of an Irishman.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they have realistic relationship issues. It was pretty obvious at the beginning that I liked both Drew and Courtney. I liked that he wasn't a complete man whore but did have a thing for a certain someone that got him through some rough times. And he wasn't completely over that someone but it wasn't like they had some intense romantic history either. It was just a crush on someone that was a total babe. Which I loved.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice touch in the end though . The movie's title has no relevancy to the movie . I was expecting something completely different . I had no expectations , and i got my moneys worth , but it wasnt a great movie , its like the director tried to make it as a low budget movie but in the process made a low budget movie . But i think it was ok to waste a saturday night with , and i would probably rent it on DVD to watch again .

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

I can't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten. To be honest, I saw the preview for this movie, and the premise looked intrigued me. Yes, I rented it after reading others' comments. They are correct in that some of the acting leaves a lot to be desired. They are also correct that one of the best performances of this movie was that of Dr. Graves.Also interesting is Scott Clark, who plays Grant, the kid in the wheelchair. I identify with the character he played, perhaps because I am in a wheelchair.This movie is certainly worth your looking at.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie ( Jason Lee ) in a sexual encounter and the two of them make a pact: They will meet and hook up one night each year on the evening of Ronnie’s wedding anniversary – a pact they have both kept throughout their adult lives. Ronnie has never told Rae about his pact and is a happily married man with two kids. Rae meanwhile is a nanny and aspiring children’s author who is still a nymphomaniac… and her life revolves around her pact with Ronnie.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as a extra. She said she had to ride a horse for hours and hours and got paid $15 for the whole day, she was just 14 and it was a very long time ago. I am 27 now. I loved it, my favorite part was when she found out who her father really was. It is a good movie, a must see for everyone. This was one of those rare times when history actually comes alive.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings to Wagon Master the qualities he has shown so often before: the vast open spaces, the sense of freedom in being on the range. It is also an adventure story, of a group of wagons trying to get to Oregon and of the people with them and the people they meet. Based on a novel by "Wood Hawkins" the movie has little or no pretensions, it is just a simple but enjoyable western.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

* spoiler * * spoilers * * spoilers * I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it very much and the story was cute.It was an awesome film, I really loved it.I found the music very good.I didn't know that the guy who played the doctor was in Harry Potter too.Great acting and a funny movie. I found the movie very interesting and entertaining to watch.It was not too long or too short, it was good and the cast was just right for the story.I found the story quite unique and it had a nice ending.It was not like any other movie I have ever seen.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have a proper script, and the shooting was so improvisational that it's almost impossible to follow. I'm not going to waste time and space explaining the plot, 'cuz there ain 't one . What I wanna write here is only an attempt to explain a little bit the movie. In 1882, after the loss of his wife and son, Henry Morton Stanley (the famous explorer) goes mad and decides to move with a group of soldiers to Africa, to find the source of the white Nile.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

Forget about Donnie Darko . I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I’ve seen have mentioned The Butterfly Effect (which, for the record, I thought was crap) in order to put The Lake House in its proper context. Some of these critics have even gone so far as to claim that the two films share more than a few similarities in their premise. I have no doubt that they’ve watched the films back-to-back in order to compare them, which is a dangerous move to make.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the Sahara desert and Algerian Atlas Mountains, focuses on three groups of people: the Tuareg, an Islamic tribe in the Sahara, the Targui tribes of Morocco, a Berber people, and the nomadic Bedouin. In the film Herzog shows how these three peoples have adapted their lives to live in this environment. At first I thought this would be a simple story about how people survive the desert. But what I found was a deeper story about the human spirit and what it means to live in the world.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should , the plot is not entirely predictable. The hero is, as usual, James Bond, without the gadgets. The female protagonist is also well-written. The only reason it gets 4 stars and not 5 is the villain is very much a cardboard villain - but in my mind, that makes him all the more evil. Great reading from start to finish! I have recently read all of the The Saint books from 1930-1941 and enjoyed all.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , Georgia and I was wondering if anyone knew how long it would take us to get there or if there would be traffic etc. If you know anything please help because we are going to be driving 3hrs. We left at 12:40 and arrived in Atlanta at 4:20. We arrived at 6:17. We had to pick up the valet, but once we checked in, got our wrist bands and went to the lobby it was a piece of cake.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound effect on me. While I don't have as much nostalgia for it now, it does hold up fairly well. It's an excellent film that does a good job of explaining some of the basics. It's a simple story but very well done. While I don't know the science behind nuclear power, it makes sense to me. I also think that it's a good story for adults and kids alike. I do think it may be a little slow for kids to watch it.

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say "french culture". I thought the way it was filmed and the editing was real good but mostly it was entertaining especially the guy that played Wendy's brother. Also the story line was really good as well as it was believable and yet adventurous as well.Favorite Part: When William is making fun of the German guy studying and when he acts out how flies reproduce! :) My french isn't that good but with the subtitles i could pretty much get what was going on. WATCH IT!

This film , released in 1951 , has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50 's , such as goodies and bad guys and a good story. It's the story of a small town , in which the residents have lived in peace and harmony for many years , until one day , the town is under attack from bandits , who are intent on driving the law abiding locals from their homes , and who are in the pay of the railroad , which wants to build its tracks in the area , and so needs the land.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar , which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything , and the movie wasn’t very good either, so I don’t have much to report. To be fair , I was distracted by the bizarre choice of venue , which is a cafe in the back of a furniture store . And the movie wasn’t very good either , so the venue was kind of irrelevant . Anyhow , Kate Winslet gives another great performance . She’s really good . She’s always really good , but she’s really, really good here .

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own and I have a weak spot for crazy horror, slasher flicks and See No Evil happens to be exactly that and more!! I think that the biggest mistake made by producers and film makers of this film is that they hype it as a WWE film and "starring" KANE. WWE might have a big following but it's a very, very specific group that follow the incredibly cheesy and (sorry folks) kind of trailer park "sport" and those who don't love it HAATTTE IT!!

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in French by the French director Rachid Bouchareb, you will understand why Algeria was so crucial to both French and Algerian History. The film gives a new perspective of Algeria and the Algerian revolution and also the role France had in it. I think the film is an open invitation for the French government to revisit its History and its relationship with its colonized country. The film was well done and I can recommend it to people interested in Algerian history or History in general.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks ( Jamie Bartlett ) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo ( Chiwetel Ejiofor ) .A member of MK who killed a white farmer in a rape revenge killing , Alex has fled to the USA and is now a doctor in California. His application is denied. Alex returns. His brother Kuda ( Hakeem Kae Kazim ) is an ex-soldier who owns a local night club where Dirk is a regular visitor . The two have been best friends since they were boys. Sarah Lindell ( Tanya van Graan ) , a young social worker arrives.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie that deserved an A plus plus it is this one. I saw this movie in theaters 3 times and when it came to VHS I bought 3 copies and gave them to my friends. I am a huge fan of sci-fi horror and Alien was one of the best movies ever made. I can't say I am a fan of Alien 3 and Alien Resurrection because they are both too dark and not scary but Aliens and Alien are both masterpieces. Scares me to death.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance , women-on-the-verge psychodrama , work place sexual harassment , adultery , and fashion . I have to admit that I was seduced by the first half of this film. The story is intriguing, and the lead actress is very beautiful. However, it is only the first 75% of the movie that is good. The last 25% is a disappointing let-down that is really uninspiring and lacking in anything new. It's been done better elsewhere. Amazing movie. Really entertaining. But the ending is a bit predictable, and the main character becomes annoying after a while.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at their best and the rest of the cast , for the most part , has little to work with , the best performances coming from a young Nick Adams and Mary Ure . The plot is trite and implausible , and I can't help feeling that a better script would have been better for this . There are some amusing touches though , and the film is enjoyable enough , I suppose . Rosalind R
A very enjoyable, light comedy, with a good story and a nice balance between the main lead characters.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I find it really good, and I'm sure most people will too! This is one of those movies that is different from most of the others, which I guess is what makes it so good. So if you're tired off seeing movies that are a copy from another movie, and are looking for a movie that's not the same thing you've seen before, this is the movie for you! I don't understand why a lot of people seem to dislike it.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game to get a college scholarship, but his self-esteem transforms into confidence, as he and the other players find that their lives and attitudes have unexpected impacts on their families. Ethan Hawke, Joshua Jackson, Karen Rosenberg, Gore Vidal
More reviews for The Rage in Placid Lake
Great performance by Jason Gann. But I found the rest of the movie rather annoying. Good film for teens. Darkly hilarious, this movie is a wonderful portrayal of adolescence at its best.

`` Jaded '' should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure but to convey the character's motives. The movie is well written, well acted and entertaining. I would definitely recommend this movie although the plot is thin. 16/12/10--06:48: The Lone Gunmen Pilot - Pilot
This is the episode that introduced the Lone Gunmen on the X-Files. It has all the charm of the X-Files, a good cast of character and lots of fun to be had by the viewer. The story revolves around a group of computer hackers, who help Mulder in finding the truth.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  boy goes to university, boy meets girl, boy and girl find out they're brother and sister - and you think, "Well, that's hardly a spoiler. I can guess what it's going to be like from the title," you don't know what's hit you. It could be the best of films, and you still wouldn't guess anything like what it's like. And it could be the worst, but then you wouldn't expect anything from it either way.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

`` Please , do n't kill me ! I 'm just an actor ! '' `` Can you play dead ? '' `` Can I play the other dead people ?'' `` I 'm good at dying! '' Born in 1974, in Beirut, I have a degree in psychology. I 'm not a professional actor , I have worked as an actor in various TV shows , commercials, and films , and have also written a TV show and a film script, which I have not had any chances yet to produce or shoot .

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the not so young. It is called "The Happiness of Kati" and is based on a true story and was filmed in 1989 in Hungary. I saw it at a film festival in Paris last month. You will not be sorry. It will stay with you. Thank you so very much for all your good wishes for our new baby girl. I know she has already been blessed with love from all her relatives, friends and, of course, all of you who care for us.

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a ten foot pole, and that 's why I'm so glad I did. I saw this flick at 9AM at a screening on a Sunday morning, and there were no other folks in the audience with me. My only real concern was not wanting to nod off in the middle of the film. Well, I did manage to do that for a couple of moments, but I think it was mostly due to lack of sleep rather than being bored.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , unfaithful , and self centred , and women are the poor victims . This film has a great sense of humor . It is a great comedy, and it's a shame that it did not become more successful because it was not even nominated for Oscar's . This film has some similarities with other film like 'Pillow talk' or 'The Trap' , and this is also the reason why I did not find this movie to be original . Overall , I liked this film .

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of film since 1961 with films as diverse as his 1982 cult classic Nosferatu: Phantom of the Night , the 2005 Oscar winning Grizzly Man and the 2010 Academy Award-nominated Cave of Forgotten Dreams. Now, at age 74, the acclaimed German director has released his 63th film, titled Into the Abyss , which shines a light into the dark corners of America’s prison system by examining the cases of two convicted murderers in 2001 in Conroe, TX.

Fantastic documentary. A movie within a movie. I'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother's death. Makes one wonder about the time and money spent in therapy. What might have happened if she didn't have that outlet? Did the therapist help her or just foster a dependency that kept his bank account flush? The audience needs to understand that divorce was less of an option in those days. She was a housewife - went to therapy instead of going to college or job training. She seemed to feel trapped by the situation.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including `the young & the restless.' However, I guess some of the profanity, violence, and sexual innuendo in the movie are not suitable for `all your children.' Anyways before the sand fills up the hourglass, let me tell you the name of the film: `Nurse Betty.' Renee Zellweger stars as Betty. She is a Kansas waitress who falls under a trance, and thinks she is a real life character of her favorite soap opera.

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

I got this movie with my BBC `` Jane Austen Collection '' ( 5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations ) and I just love it. In my opinion, the best thing about the movie is the scenaristic, it's beautiful and the actors and actresses are the best for those roles. You should know, this is an old movie, in a black and white, which is great. It's a must see for Pride and Prejudice fans and it's not expensive at all, so, why don't you buy it ?

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old. I loved it then and still do. The ensemble cast is great - in those days the actors acted "naturally" and you "felt" for them in the respective roles. A "glossy" film of the period -the relationships therein still relevant to today's world but now the sexes are on the same level, women would not or should not allow the type of treatment displayed in the past. The soundtrack music is wonderful and it is a delight that Film Score Monthly released the CD in January, 2005.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way ! ! When I first tuned in to America 's Next Top Model, I knew it was not a show I would want my daughter to see, so I hid it in a secret place so that when my daughter went on a trip, she would not find it. But every time I watched the show I could not get enough of it. Now my daughter has caught on to it and she is also hooked on this show. Tyra Banks is an amazing woman and a great example of an African American woman who is a leader in business.

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

Michelle , Anicée Alvina , was so nice , and I really fall in love with her . She died in a car accident . I'm still in the pain of my lost, but I'm trying to find the answer about life and death. I don't want to let her memory be forgotten by anyone. I'm also trying to keep in touch with people who cared for her as I did, to make a group that can share her life and love . I hope this page will be a page for her memory and also her life.

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

I saw the Messiah : - The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I've seen on television. Especially the opening 20 seconds. 10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I have only seen one thus far ( Wim Wenders ), but if the rest are at all as good as the first, then it is a must see. Post by josie andrews » Sun May 21, 2006 10:14 pm
I agree - that's an interesting concept, and if I were in the area I would check it out for sure. Thanks for letting us know about it, and the name of the documentary!

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really do n't approve of pornography all that much. This particular movie is one of the few exceptions, however. For those of you out there who like lesbians, you'll probably be disappointed. The entire movie has only about ten minutes of lesbian sex. Otherwise, however, it's extremely enjoyable. If you are looking for a great lesbian story with lots of sex, then look elsewhere. This one is much more interested in the characters than in their sex. The sex is just a bonus.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because it is very much more affordable . When they came out, I had the first few episodes on Dvd . I was hooked on it immediately and bought every season on DVD since then . The show is excellent , and you have some great performances from the entire cast . This is really a top notch tv series. I have seen every episode. The writers, cast and production staff do a really excellent job with each new episode.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows Lazarus a former blues musician who after the loss of his son has turned towards God . One day he happens upon Rae, a sexually abused woman whose boyfriend has left her for his drug dealer . Lazarus decides to take her in and attempt to “cure” her sex addiction with the only method he knows how . I will admit that this was not one of the better acting performances I have ever seen but with that being said the cast was great and the dialogue is very interesting .

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

Do n't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit , crisp dialog or clever social commentary . This time period does not seem to be the right venue for such wittiness . What you will get here are some good songs , some good dance routines & some good acting . And this movie has all three . So do give this movie a chance . Its worth seeing . The movie may not be 100 % accurate , but for a movie it does not matter . What matters is how much you liked it and for me I like it .

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has heart and that’s all you want from movies. So yes, you have to be in the right mood for this movie and you know what? You have to want it to be great for it to be. I didn’t want it to be great but I was willing to go with it. And I loved it so much that it reminded me why I fell in love with film in the first place , why I wanted to do this in the first place….

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . . . that you are `` Blue, '' that you are, in fact, bluer than me . . . but you don't like me at all. You're not blue,'' he said finally. When I am in the blue mood I can do nothing but be blue. What do they call this color--this blue of the sea? I think of it as the blue of distance, of farthings that are never seen.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys , but providing a film to inform us that they were a thing. It's been awhile since we've seen any movies like this. If it were not for this film I wouldn't even know there was any such thing. It's a great story about a father and son's journey to be reunited after the boy's mother, the girlfriend of the cowboy dad has been killed. It was very emotional and heartfelt. A beautifully crafted western that is very much worth seeing!

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw this on Netflix , but it's also on Amazon Prime as well . I found this movie to be really funny . . . . and sad . . . as it's a documentary about two people in their 60s whose parents had been married to each other for over 50 years . When they finally decide to divorce after all these years . . . both kids try to figure out why . . . and both come to a conclusion that their parents didn't even know how to have a good marriage .

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks 1939 film `` Only Angels Have Wings '' in it's atmosphere. This time , though , the location is Canada and not Mexico as in Hawks movie. I enjoyed this one. The print is excellent , and the film also has the added attraction for me, of a beautiful actress in the starring role . She's Jean Parker , by the way , who in my book rates with Faye Wray , Ginger Rogers and Janet Gaynor as the sexiest women in films.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

My favorite film this year. Great characters and plot, and the direction and editing was smooth, visually beautiful, and interesting. Set in Barcelona, the film follows a year in the lives of six foreign graduate students and assorted others. Cultures and languages clash but hearts and lives intertwine. The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood, but he carried the part perfectly. The characters were nicely developed and their interplay was honest and accurate. There were two especially noteworthy scenes, the climax was truly inspired.

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

Style over substance . But what a style it is . `` The Cell '' is the internal version of the ``Matrix'' and it's the most stylish movie I've seen so far this year . This is a must see for anyone interested in special effects , and an eye opener to the possibilities of modern movie technology . You are a medical investigator called in to observe a prisoner suspected of committing the most horrific crimes . A serial killer who has killed 23 victims so far and you have to help find a way to keep this prisoner alive long enough so that they can find a cure for him .

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , the cinematography and editing in some of the scenes were really good . One scene in particular stood out , in which a man is running down a street and the camera is looking at his feet running on the ground while the shot is moving towards him . That is not something that is easy to do . There is a real good balance in the story between the comedy, drama and suspense elements of the story . The story and characters are well developed .

'The Cell ' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally . The mind is a beautiful place and the mind of a serial killer is just as intriguing . The Cell focuses on one serial killer, Marie( Jennifer Lopez) as she is interviewed by a prison psychiatrist ( Vince Vaughan). This is a very different movie than you might expect but it's so well made and well done that it's worth a watch. The Cell has a dark and gritty feel to it with some scenes that are very disturbing.

There's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster, Sergeant Rutledge, and The Sun Shines Bright. It was these three films with no box office names in them that Ford didn't have to tailor the film around the persona of a star being it John Wayne, Henry Fonda, or any of the others he worked with. Not surprising that Ford considered all these as favorites of one kind or another. Ben Johnson and Harry Carey, Jr. a couple of likable cowpokes sign on to guide a Mormon wagon train to a valley in Arizona territory.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee , it is evident in his movie . Forget the Black guy on White girl story , this is just good old Southern fun. So, in short , I don't think you'll be disappointed! Having said that, you can't help but compare this with the original . It's a bit more gory for starters but the movie is just a little bit lame . I think if they did a straight remake , I'd be happy. The original is just a classic . Still , you get some fun moments and some good scarey moments !

1981's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there. It's one of the finest-made slashers of the 80's and it easily blows movies like The Final Terror, Don't Go in the Woods, or The Prey out of the water.A group of young adults come to check out the mountain property that one of the group has just bought. However they are not alone in the wild. A hulking in-bred murderer, who seems to be in two places at once, is lurking and apparently hates trespassers.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.
