I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled such a theme. However I was hoping for a much better storyline . The story of a woman and her quest for love. The story of a woman who dares to dream. A dream that has always been shattered. Will the man who she marries be the man she has dreamt of or will her dream be shattered once again? This is a film about an urban woman who decides to do things for herself without any male help.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight, he lives in this burned down old hotel, where eight teen convicts go to do some cleaning. Most of them die except for 3 of them. In my case it wasn't the best writing or the best ever. I still thought that the killing scenes were really well done. Like when the one girl go eaten by the hungry dogs. The best had to be when he shoved the cell phone down the Blonde Girl's mouth. Kane was a seriously great horror movie actor, he had this serious look the entire movie and it would never change.

In Mississippi, the former blues man Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) is in crisis, missing his wife that has just left him. He finds the town slut and nymphomaniac Rae (Chritina Ricci) dumped on the road nearby his little farm, drugged, beaten and almost dead. Lazarus brings her home, giving medicine and nursing and nourishing her like a father, keeping her chained to control her heat. When her boyfriend Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) is discharged from the army due to his anxiety issue, he misunderstands the relationship of Lazarus and Rae, and tries to kill him.

I too saw this movie when it first came out. I was a teenager at the time, and I saw it with my girl friend who later became my wife. I remember the movie made me feel it was possible to beat the odds. The cinematography was very well done if memory serves me correctly. The boy was a little much, but the girl character was very interesting. I thought it was very romantic and that might have been the intro to the first time with my then girlfriend. I have not seen the movie since and I wander why it has gone to the wayside.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with a solid plot and a great supporting cast. The opening sequence of the Lone Ranger's origins is quite good. Clayton Moore makes for an excellent Lone Ranger and Jay Silverheels is a great sidekick, Tonto, who is just as good a character as the Lone Ranger. John Hart, who has a minor role, does a great job of portraying Cavendish, the Ranger's arch nemesis. Hart was a character actor from the early 20's, who had a distinguished career that lasted until his death in 1979.

Absolutely, I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting,fascinating and certainly beautiful film. It's not necessary to see all the episodes,since the first ones are the best,while the last ones are a-bit tiresome,but for any person who likes German's and their good-natured ways,all episodes are worth seeing.In typical german fashion, values are constantly questioned,even it's murderous Nazi past is confronted in the last episodes, the rich dialogues are particularly interesting. These episodes are recommended for anyone who is about to live or travel in Germany,preferably in original language!

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p. I enjoyed the film, the twists and turns in the plot and that the file was mainly about the main character Sinuhe makes it more of a "family saga" rather than an action film. The costumes and attention to detail was remarkable for its time (1955). The back projection during the chariot ride now looks clumsy. My main interest was in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth? 15 park avenue is the story of an alternative reality of a schizophrenic (Mithi). The movie is about her search for her home at a fictitious address where her imaginary husband and 5 children live. Aparna Sen delivers yet another masterpiece. Each and every actor of the movie was better than the other. Konkona Sen looks unbelievably convincing as a schizophrenic. She pulls off the role with such ease and maturity beyond her age. Shabana Azmi is incredible as usual.

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it many times to understand the plot . This movie is an art work . I loved this movie. It's one of my all time favorites. I was so impressed after seeing the trailer. When i saw it finally it turned out way better then the trailer. I don't believe this was the worst movie of 2010 at all. I thought it was good and I didn't get confused or anything like other people say they did. It's a very confusing movie though.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year. It was a truly moving experience. I had heard of the Truth and Reconcilliation process, but as others have written, did not know much about the details of the process. This film demonstrated the process and the growth that can occur when people are able to face up to their pasts, understand the events from the points of view of others involved, and grieve together. Archbishop Tutu and the others involved in developing the T & R process deserve recognition for their understanding of human emotions.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore . I 'm sure it pisses a few liberals off . I'm a libertarian myself so I thought I'd get a few things off my chest . First off the show was hilarious . The last 10 minutes is what makes the whole episode . It's a 2 part joke that starts off as "hey look Al is fat "and then it goes into the fact that Al Gore has some of the worst luck in human history . If you look at this from a libertarian point of view it's pretty funny.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

This movie is Wonderful! I can watch it again and again. Robin hood is Perfectly cast, and Marian is beautiful. I personally think Marian's German man is the funniest character, along with Latrine and the Sheriff! While space balls got boring and stupid after a while, this one always keeps your interest! W O N D E R F U L This was a great film, and never gets boring. A great cast is in the roles, and it is spoofed perfectly, and makes so much sense, and can be watched again and again!

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

I 'm a fan of independent film . Dialogue driven , character study pieces are where it 's at for me . I love a lot of films but I like to support the independent scene more than any other. You have a lot to offer and there 's so much talent out there that needs support. I have been a screenwriter for 4 years and have completed 6 scripts so I know a little about the process. My writing has been described as realistic and raw. I believe that is a product of my background and real world experience.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I never saw the movie in theaters and somehow it got over looked when it first came out on Netflix. I didn’t think much of it when I saw the Netflix listing but it looked like something my wife and I might enjoy. I was a little worried when the movie began as it was set in a prison cell and it looked like it was going to be one of those artsy independent film type things. It quickly changed and started to feel like a much more traditional crime thriller.

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in an elevator where two women are in a conversation. The elevator is getting crowded, two more enter and it is getting really hot. Then one of the women opens the elevator door and all five of them get out. I don`t think any one has tried to find that scene in this version. There are several things that are changed in the 2012 remake. Some things that were changed I can agree on, but some others I cannot.

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's not to say it wasn 't going to get bigger, it probably was going to, but surely it could have been handled a bit better. The people in charge of Iraq and Afghanistan don 't have a plan to get us out. We 're spending tens of billions a year, losing lives every month, and the end doesn 't seem to be coming any closer. It 's not like it was a secret that invading Iraq and Afghanistan wasn 't going to be an easy thing.

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile relationships with each other. And how a moment in time can change the dynamic between us and how we move forward. Also how the past can affect us all in different ways ! I would like to give a shout out to my Mom ! I know she is watching . It's not easy but I really do appreciate all you do ! I also have to give a shout out to all you Moms and Dads out there !

I have watched this show from the beginning, and I am a 45 year old man. To me, this is so much more that a show that appeals to women. This is the story of a family, possibly an unusual one, but a family none the less. It centers around a mother and daughter, Lorelei and Rory Gilmore, two bright, attractive, and in their own ways successful women. Lorelei makes her home in fictional Stars Hollow, CT, a small New England town with a sense of history, and a population of people that may be unusual, but acts as a dysfunctional family.

This movie is Wonderful ! I can watch it again and again . Robin hood is Perfectly cast , and the actors are Wonderful . I think everyone is going to enjoy it. It has action , romance , humor , and great acting. I did not expect a movie like that. I love it! I will watch it again. Very good movie, great cast, story and music. I did not expect much from this film. I was surprised and very satisfied. An excellent performance by the entire cast! This was a great rendition of the age old story.

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's circle. I've even heard it called an "adult's cartoon" because of the sexual content (not nudity). Well, adults do have sexual lives (gasp! ), right? The story lines are clever, witty and very adult. I'm 31 and still laugh out loud every time I watch this series. This is what cartoons are all about. You have no idea. Daria is a teenage girl who attends High School in the town of Lawndale.

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

`` Two Hands '' is an entertaining , funny story about Australian lowlifes . The screenplay contrasts the world of crime with that of the ordinary family life . A young man named Joe, who is a petty thief , strives to get out of the clutches of crime and go to a normal life . He realizes that he does not want to be a gangster and gets involved in a robbery to his boss to make enough money to go to a remote island in Australia and start a new life. But everything goes awry and the police pursue Joe, who gets caught between the crime world and ordinary life .

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . And the reason is that this album is an absolute classic . Sometimes , I do not understand how people can say this one of her best work. But in reality , I think that they are all amazing , they are all gems and each of them has something that touches me . This one is a bit more difficult to understand , but that is also the reason that I like . It is one of my favorites from Carpenter because it is different than all the others .

When I was engaged , my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores . He would look for his books , and I would shop around the shelves for anything else that caught my eye . I wanted to see what else was out there , and what it all entailed . So I purchased a couple books and started reading . One of the books that I purchased was called Bottoms Up . I found it fascinating to read as it went through many different fetishes . I also found it a little sad that some people actually have these fetishes .

The best of everything. Just what is the best of everything? It is different for everyone but for most of us it is love. But alas not everyone knows where or who to look to for real love. This story goes the whole gambit of looking for love. Sometimes in all the wrong places and for all the wrong reasons. But as the saying goes,"we are the captains of our own ships", and so it goes for our lives. We are responsible for the choices that we make in our lives. Once we make those choices then we must live with them.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie . Amy Jo Johnson ( Susie Q ) is a great Actress . She's one of my favourite Actress . She can act very good . I can watch this movie very often . I like it so much . Amy Jo Johnson is one of my favourite Actress . This movie is very good . I can watch it often. This is one of my favourite teen movies from the 2010s. I like this teen movie . I like this teen movie . I love the actors . I think this movie is great . I think it's romantic .

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. I watched the whole series and was totally enthralled. It was extremely well written, acted, filmed, shot and directed, and, as with all good drama, had the viewer engrossed and eager to get back to watch more. I found the storyline engrossing and interesting, and not once did I find the acting poor, the story unrealistic or feel that I'd been misled. I thought the whole thing was fantastically presented, and if anything the ending, while sad, felt right and was believable.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an erotic film , yes , but it’s not one that is just trying to push the envelope and get people hot and bothered , like so many porn films do today. This is a simple story that involves a woman who takes a break from her boyfriend only to find out that she misses him . She takes a trip to his place to see if anything can be worked out. They find themselves in a situation where all they can do is bang and bang some more .

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it's an enjoyable little film. Writer/director J.R. Reher makes the best of his micro-budget, with an attractive cast who look and sound the parts, and a nice attention to detail which adds to the story and atmosphere. The story is an intriguing mixture of genres - it's basically an action movie about a man trying to save his wife, with elements of romantic comedy and horror - and it succeeds because Reher is confident enough in what he's trying to do.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

**SPOILERS AHEAD**It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. I thought this was full of (silly) clichés andthat it basically tried to hard. To the (American) guys out there: how many of you spend yourtime jumping on your girlfriend's bed and making monkeysounds? To the (married) girls: how many of you have suddenlygone from prudes to nymphos overnight--but not with yourhusband? To the French: would you really ask about someonebeing "à la fac" when you know they don't speak French?

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes ( with the exception of the final one that aired tonight) it's a bit hard for me to remember what I want to mention. So, just going off memory, I would have to say my favorite episode of Season 11 is probably " The One With All the Cheesecakes " and " The One Where Ross Dates A Student." I know, I know they are not exactly the best episodes but they are my favorites and that's all you can really ask for, right?
"

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . I hope to find some more Dogma films out there and see where it all started . I would also like to find out more about other countries and there Dogma movements . There are a lot of great films out there , just waiting to be seen. I think Fuckland is one of those films and i highly recommend it to you . I am really glad it was sent to me for a review . I am thankful for being able to watch such a great movie .

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is shiny or that water is wet . This movie is a 1985 British-French production that's basically about some guy that's in an accident and becomes a zombie . But this movie really isn't as simple as I just described it to you . The movie is about zombies and vampires . It's about a group of friends that take a trip through Europe and get into all kinds of trouble . The movie is directed by Neil Jordan who is famous for the movie " Mona Lisa" .

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I had expected. There's still plenty of blood and violence in the film but it's not over the top like I had assumed it would be from the trailers I saw. Instead Just Before Dawn focuses more on the characters and the setting than it does the horror and violence. That's not to say it's boring, there's a surprising amount of action, but that it's better than most of these slasher movies.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (formerly from En Vogue) being in it. There were a lot of big named artists that did some of my favorite songs from the 70's and early 80s. I have to look up all of the songs they did that I remember, but it was a great show . I just saw that they had a follow-up show last year and hopefully it is coming back soon. If you missed it on PBS I would highly recommend buying the DVD.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant stream of gushing about it. I didn't much like the first film, so I was already in a bad mood when I saw the second film. So let me make one thing clear: I think it's rubbish. However, this is more than just a personal reaction; I think there is something fundamentally wrong with what it is. I think it has to do with narrative and what it is trying to accomplish. My first point is that it fails as an adaptation.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17. The only good thing my father ever did (get us in). This is "our movie" and the music is "our songs". Michelle's song is "our" song. Yeah, nowadays, it's a crime to show naked children on the screen, but we were screwing at 16, why not these kids? The movie is- rich boy impregnates poor girl, then rich dad steals him away from her at the end, after she gives birth under impoverished conditions. She is left alone with child.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed the beginning due to late arrival!). I wanted to see everything, to try and pick up on every detail that had escaped me, which was quite a lot! I'd recommend watching this several times as well as reading a review as I feel that you can't get the full picture without the review. The characters are so multi layered, and you really get to see the different sides to them, and I loved that!

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been looking for a dvd of it, I was not a fan of the original movie. I've seen a lot of movies in my day but I've never seen a movie like "Hellcab". The acting, directing, scripting, and all the other aspects were so well done that it really gave you a feel that you were a passenger on the cab. It was a very realistic and moving movie that had me feeling everything the cab driver was feeling.

Despite all it 's trappings of style and cinematic invention , this is basically another serial killer thriller , following in the footsteps of Silence of the Lambs, Seven, Scream and countless other examples . In fact , this is one of the very best examples of the type I've seen : it's scary without resorting to ghosts or monsters ; its characters are sharply written and played and it's full of interesting ideas and images . One such image is that opening shot of a lorry parked up in a darkened field with a girl in a white wedding dress on the back.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through. It has a great ensemble of characters, an origional plot, and an ending I shoulda seen coming but didn't and pulls at your heart strings.If theres any one thing about this movie that got me the most it was Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock's interaction. These two are great and it warms my heart to see Rock isn't going to do crappy Big Hollywood fare like Lethal Weapon 4 for the rest of his life. Freeman is as always the man, really there shouldnt be any need to critique his work anymore.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as Noir. This was a dark and cynical genre that featured down on their luck anti-heroes like Sam Spade, Philip Marlowe and other detectives who were all too human. The noir detectives had all the trappings of a hard drinking, womanizing life but still managed to be honorable and moral men. Even when they had to do immoral acts they did it for the greater good. One of those characters was Richard Diamond, Private Detective. In fact Diamond was probably the prototypical American private eye.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it, I love it ! Sweet, funny, sad, the actors are doing a really great job and there's always something new, unexpected ! I don't want to say a lot about it, you'll have to discover the movie by yourself ! I'd really love to see what's happening next, a sequel would make my day ! Posted in Movies and TV series, Non classé on 6 March 2013 by Mag. ← Obligation !

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa and the apartheid era. But it is good to be reminded, because apartheid was something that could so easily become an abstraction. That it did, and that it did so in so many places, is one reason why we are still discussing apartheid. In this sense, the setting is the most obvious and the most important feature of Red Dust and this alone makes it worth watching. It is a political thriller, a thriller set in a political milieu.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . My parents had gone into the city, and I snuck along with an older friend. The only film I'd ever seen that was remotely close to the subject matter was The African Queen. But it was a very different story, and even more different setting. There was, however, one important common element; both films were directed by two of the greatest directors of our time, John Ford and Robert Wise.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against Yankee aggressors bent on plundering, looting, and burning their homes. Along with the women & children, a band of local patriots are left to fend for themselves without military protection in this, their own country, as Union soldiers have captured the garrison and all able bodied defenders. GENERAL SPANKY, who has a love affair with the youngest daughter, MARY QUEEN, decides to stay in the area to aid these patriots.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect. Here Alice is a virginal librarian who falls down the rabbit hole and learns to love sex and her own self image. Made at the time when adult films were creative endeavors with plots instead of just a series of sex scenes, this is a good looking little movie more akin to the low budget films of its day. Despite what you may think this film actually has a good script with funny jokes and good songs. Its an naughty little tale for adults.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , my older brother and I would go with our dad to work on weekends. We would follow him in our dad's 1974 Ford Bronco. He was a heavy-set man, so the seats in the old 70's truck were always a little small for him , but not too small for us. My brother and I would climb into the front seats with our dad and we would laugh and talk the whole ride over to work.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning to end and so far we didn't find a better address in the whole world. We love the people, we love this house, it was our dream to live in a house as beautiful as a film house and we finally did it. It's a beautiful location and very peaceful, away from the maddening city crowd. We have lived in 10 different places across the country and this is our best home and we are glad to have found it at this address.

The `` Hunting Trilogy '' of Rabbit Fire ( 1951 ) , Rabbit Seasoning ( 1952 ) , and Duck Hunt 2006 ) is a classic of American humour writing and has achieved a permanent place in American literature. But while the books have their readers, I have to say that I’ve always had a hard time getting in touch with them. They just aren’t my kind of story. It’s the old adage that “to each his own” and I understand that there are plenty of people who like these books. Unfortunately I just don’t see it myself.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It kept us laughing every single day. The show kept the funniness at a high level. We were not bored during the show at all. We are glad that we was able to watch. I love that the show brought a lot of joy to those who watch it, and we were very happy to be a part of it. I am not a black person but I was still entertained. I laughed very hard while watching this series.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Indians for what appears at first to be no apparent reason..that is until the Lone Ranger discovers from a conversation with the Indian Chief Tomache that each man possessed a medallion. The five medallions given by Tomache to his friends as gifts we later learn when combined will provide the mastermind behind the hooded raiders with a map to a legendary lost city of gold. Can the Lone Ranger protect the remaining two individuals in possession of the medallions before the hooded raiders get their hands on it?

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 100 on 100 . It gives you something which we rarely find in today's cinema. To me it was more or less like 'The Graduate'. I just hope that the movie does very well and people come to know about it . One of my favorite films for sure. The best film I have seen for the last decade. It is beautiful in every aspect. The screenplay, cinematography, acting and music are all exquisite. Must watch for cine-aesthete.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name of the town. I remember those days and miss them now. It was my Dad's hobby too. He loved airplanes, and I still have his collection of airplane pictures, posters, photos. Nice post. My dad worked at United Airways in the 1950's as a pilot and he took a similar photo from the cockpit, which I have. I think he also had photos from airport terminals. I love looking at these photos.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

There are many film now on DVD , but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers . We have to ask ourselves how come ? There is no doubt that DVD has been a success . Now everybody can see and buy their favorite movies . The only drawback is that it's costly , as they sell them for about $20.00 dollars each . It is also a drawback that not all the movies were made available . I will give some of those tittles so everybody can see for themselves . Some of these movies on this list I have never seen .

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

It came before "the ten commandments" "land of the Pharaohs" "Ben Hur" and it's overlooked today.How unfair!Based on Mika Waltari's mammoth novel ,it doesn't cheapen it!Waltari's novel was so huge only a miniseries could have done it justice (I hope it will be done some day).Waltari,whose message is essentially Christian remains intact(another of his books "the secret of the kingdom" (first part) takes place after Christ's death in the Holy Land).

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqué for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are about to travel to the west. When the Mormons' leader is accidentally killed, the travelers take his place and pretend to lead them to the holy land. They use the horse traders' horses and supplies as well as the money that the travelers have to buy the supplies. The horse traders eventually discover the scheme and attempt to escape, but they end up trapped with the travelers on a desolate plain where no help can reach them.

"Jaded" takes on the complex question of abuse: the perpetrators and the victims. In lesser hands it would have degenerated into an erotic thriller made for direct-to-video. This director, however, has managed to pull off a textured multi-layered study with a decidedly different point of view.Given the fact that the director/writer is a woman and the main detective and D.A. are also women, this could have turned into a very anti-male film. It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

This movie makes you think. It shows how a woman's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others. Her physically aggressive behavior is more often seen in men than women, so it made me feel even more uncomfortable to see the way the lead actress behaved. I think that women might think about this behavior, but I don't think they act on it. The dark scenes added to the sense of evil that needed to be hidden. I was relieved when the prisoners escaped. I was hopeful that the end would bring a satisfying solution, but it did not.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

The above summary really isn't meant as a slam against this film, as the series followed a very similar format. As usual, Simon Templar ("The Saint") meets a lady in distress and comes to her aid. He also comes to the aid of a police detective who was framed of accepting a bribe. Along the way, he meets some interesting supporting characters (this time, Paul Guilfoyle as "Pearly" Gates) and during his unraveling of this not especially compelling mystery (none of them really are), Templar is extremely erudite and just plain cool!

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments, Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air. The film is like no other I have ever seen. Director Neil LaBute proves that he can direct more then disturbing pictures of men and women and how they approach sex (his previous two films were the brillant In the Company of Men, and the almost brillant Your Friends and Neighbors). Renee Zellweger gives the best performance of her career as Betty, a waitress who, when she witnessing the brutal death of her asshole husband (LaBute mainstay Aaron Eckhart), and gets lost in a fantasy world.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets look like the same sets used for the sets of Ben-Hur , including the Colosseum, a couple of temples and other buildings. Also notice how this is the only movie that the famous actress Susan Hayward did not get an Oscar nomination for; in this film she plays Valeria, a prostitute who later falls in love with Ben-Hur. Hayward plays the role with great passion and intensity, but she gets no nomination at the Academy Awards, probably due to her character's status as an immoral prostitute.

Fantastic documentary . A movie within a movie . I 'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother 's Death . His Father 's work lives on as well. Terrific doc on a filmmaker who deserves the respect of the genre. An amazing, heartfelt doc about a man who made his life out of his passion. An inspiration to every filmmaker out there and a great way to pay tribute to the great man. Movies like this one makes me appreciate documentaries and the passion of the makers. I think it is very touching how this film is about a loving man who loved movies and his work.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surfacey characterisation and a rather silly and unconvincing plot. Still, the music and dance routines make it all worthwhile, even if this isn't quite up to 'The Boy from Oz'. In terms of the story - a young Irish lad named Pete (Jake Canuso) leaves his homeland in search of a better life in New York where he meets and befriends a young waitress called Tessie (Anna McDonald). After many trials and tribulations Pete becomes the most successful and famous of the Ziegfeld Follies stars.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist, I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. When I first saw the trailer for 'Black Snake Moan' I laughed and thought, "Great. Another 'Snakes on a Plane' Samuel L Jackson movie". But of course, I wanted to see it for the laugh factor. Many people have judged this movie too quickly based on the innuendo in the title, the images on promotional ads and on the fact that Justin Timberlake is in the film. Personally I loved every second of this movie.

"The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends," says Marion Fairlie, who with her half-sister, Laura, lives in a vast mid-Victorian country estate. "And last night I found myself in Limmeridge churchyard. Normally, people who are dead stay dead, just as normally it is the criminals who are locked up rather than the victims. But then, there was nothing normal about what happened to us..." And we're off on a first-class Gothic story of madness, deception and villainy, based on Wilkie Collins' great novel of Victorian mystery.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a man , a great director , but also of a country , America , and the entire human race . A vision of what is to come that will haunt your thoughts for years to come . I think if you take a good look at it , this film is an exploration and explanation of what we all really are at the root and how it all came about . If you don't get this you have missed the boat .

Personally , I regard `` The Egyptian '' in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Egyptian artist,who I have known since 1993 when I met her on a trip to Egypt.In 1997 I bought my first piece of genuine,high quality Egyptian papyrus,and it still hangs proudly on the wall of the lounge of my home . I have since bought further items from Egyptian Papyrus . I have always been totally impressed by the quality of the papyrus,its artwork and the efficiency and speed with which these items have reached my door.

i love this movie. is it on air anymore? what can i do to get it on air again because i miss this movie when does this movie air again? i love this movie so much. does anyone know how long it has been since it was last on Disney?it has been a very very long time and i am so sick of waiting!i want to see Susie Q again. i swear, they take all the good movies off air and play new stupid gay ones that are fake and retarded.

I shot this movie. I am very proud of the film. It was a great experience which shows up on the screen. Halfdan Hussey is an excellent collaborator who had a vision and was able to capture the movie in the exact way we envisioned while prepping the film. The sets are amazing and well crafted for each character. John York and his team built sets that not only fit the characters, they worked well in shooting the film, allowing us to move seamlessly through walls and from one set to another. Each character has an amazing arc, which makes for a great story.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends & Neighbors , to write and direct The Shape of Things . The film is a story of love, obsession and manipulation in which two characters change each others lives forever. Paul Rudd and Rachel Weisz play a seemingly typical college professor and student who fall in love, only to discover their love and attraction for each other has the potential to lead to the downfall of both characters and all their relationships. This is a darker and more disturbing movie than either of LaBute's previous works.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's. It is an old fashioned kind of movie in that sense, I guess that is why I like it so much. For a student of that time, it is not hard to put yourself into the shoes of the main actors. Some of the scenes are fun to watch as they are based on true life experiences. The acting is not that good, but who cares when you are young and have fun. And it has the right atmosphere and soundtrack to complete the whole picture.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too much for my taste at some moments) but no less compelling for that ; an excellent piece of thriller and mystery. It’s not the best that I’ve ever read, yet it keeps you turning the pages to the very last one. The plot is very clever, I have to admit. You’re left wondering, what the hell is going on ? and who can be trusted? and what the hell is the author trying to say ?

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one. The acting is fine, there are some great lines and situations in the dialogs and the storyline, and I think the plot is rather good. I watched it a dozen of times when I was 25 years old, and still I enjoy it very much today, some 30 years later. This is a film I would recommend to anybody who is tired of all the CGI-driven big-budget Hollywood blockbusters out there.

There 's a brand new killer on the loose , and he 's doing God 's work . Yeah right . But the thing is this one has no qualms about killing innocent bystanders if it gets in the way of him doing God 's work. And that's the problem . We've all read about those crazy people killing the doctor's that are performing late term abortions. There's something about killing a person that they disagree with. Well it seems there's something about killing innocent people on the sly that these folks like to do.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships, 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the spotlight on his own family, Block covers terrain that is off-limits for most filmmakers. He explores a common but often unspoken family dynamic and does so without resorting to hyperbole or sensationalism. In fact, the film is deceptively low key at the outset. In addition to providing a probing look at one family - and, by extension, every family - Block has also chronicled a very specific period in recent history. I don't know if this was intentional, but unavoidable due to archival content.Highly recommended.

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must have lead . It's not often I give a ten for a movie but this was a perfect 10 from the start to the finish . It's not your usual film with some stupid action or special effects and a lot of nonsense story line . Just an excellent film with an excellent story and excellent performances from all involved . I'd love to see some more films made by this cast and director with this story . I will definitely purchase the dvd to enjoy this story again and again .

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe not . But here goes . I can say it is a story told by someone who is not sure who they are . This is the second time I’ve heard this music and , for the most part , I liked it . I like the music . I like the melody line and , as a whole , I like the album. The only thing I didn’t really like was the voice .

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in Spain. I am glad to know about this film and I hope to get hold of a copy. This documentary is very nice. I wish it will be more accessible to the public. I was very happy to learn about Erasmus students and their problems, in my opinion, this kind of movies is more important than commercial movies. I have enjoyed very very much of this documentary. The Erasmus experience has been showed very good, I can say I have lived the same.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary , it is obviously a labor of love, one which I'm grateful to have seen. From the very beginning, this documentary hooks you with a very well done opening montage, which includes archival footage interspersed with modern footage , which makes for some very nice continuity. We get a good sense that this movie is very serious about covering the topic it is going to present, and the filmmakers have done an excellent job of presenting the information in a very clear and concise manner, which keeps you hooked the whole time.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy of it there. I was expecting a film about the man himself, Akhenaten, but it is a drama about an art historian in modern day Egypt who finds Akhenaten on a visit to the museum. Apart from the fact that he is dead for about 3500 years he is the spit and image of Akhenaten. The story concerns the relationship between the two men and between the art historian's son and his friend's son.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, there's very little that makes sense. On the other hand, the thing is really fun. In the film, a series of killings has people in the town of Mooneyhead (I swear this place does exist) very worried - and when one of them has a vision about a possible future victim, things really get messed up. A detective is brought in to deal with things, but things just keep getting worse, as the killings start to multiply.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has so much comedy and so much heart that it needs to be recognized. This is one show that has not missed a beat. Please give it a chance and give it its due credit. This show is my absolute favorite, and it has not missed a beat in all these years!! It has its own loyal following, but it does not get nearly the credit it deserves. I just can not say enough good things about this show.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work and I would recommend it to anyone who likes a good story . It's an intense rollercoaster ride . I would like to thank Netgalley and publisher St Martin's Press for an advance reading copy in exchange for an honest review . This is the second book I have read and I absolutely loved it . It is very well written . The characters are well defined . The story flows and you can't put it down . A must read!!!!!!

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

I had always heard about this great mini-series , but viewed it for the first time this week , July of 2018. It’s about 4 young people , one a girl , who are brought together because of a murder. It’s 1980-something , and the 4 go from being strangers to close friends , but when they go to New York for the weekend they discover the murder may have been one of their friends and things go from bad to worse , they get into a car accident , and the story continues.

I 'm not the type of person to watch T.V . shows because the acting normally sucks or it 's to gory for my taste. I think it 's a bad sign when the actors are more famous than the character. I do make exceptions for a few select shows. The most recent addition to this list is Breaking Bad. I have a confession to make, I don 't like the main character. This is not a reflection of the character Walter White. I really don 't know what it means, but the show is so well done that he is easily the least interesting person on the show.

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for me personally the best of everything is to eat the best food, drink the best wine, stay at the best hotels, and travel to the best destinations. My goal is to help you make those dreams come true. Luxury Hotel Review. The best hotels in Paris . Best Hotel Reviews . Best Hotels . Best Hotels for romance . The best Hotels in Paris . Best Hotels for the best views of Paris. Best Hotels in France. The best Hotels in New York City.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , it made me smile and laugh ! I am so happy to see this story about friendship and family. I wish we could have more of this kind of movies like this in the theaters. It is a movie you will not be sorry you have seen. The best part of this movie is the friendship between these four women. I think this kind of friendship are very rare. I wish I had 4 girlfriends like these women .

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries , I did n't expect much from 'Two Weeks Notice'. But, it turned out to be funnier than 'The In-Laws', with more depth. At times, it was almost a satire, but in the end, it kept the balance. The movie is well casted. Sandra Bullock has a good screen presence. I liked her better than Harrison Ford or Hugh Grant. It is fun to watch them spar with one another in the movie. I thought Hugh Grant's performance was excellent and the movie was better than I expected.

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A Map. '' These signs are there for the visitors and also tourists of the beautiful country. The signs are there to guide the tourists so that they can find the way of the place. It is not compulsory for everyone that they should always go on the roads that have signs. There are times when the travellers do not see all the signs on the roads. They do not pay proper attention. It is always advisable for the travellers to stay on the side of the road and not cross it.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish film ( the other one was Girl with the Dragon tattoo 1-1) . But since I was in Sweden last month , I wanted to watch a Swedish movie and my sister suggested me a horror movie . I don’t usually watch scary films , but this one wasn’t anything I wasn’t expecting . The only thing that kept me attached to the screen was the main character played by Mira Grosin . She is incredible .

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was based on an actual real life incident. It turns out to be true. This movie is based on real life incident which came to the limelight in 1995 when there was a serial killing of 3 female students by Bal Thackeray’s son who was the editor of a tabloid. One of the victims was also a journalist and she had the courage to reveal Bal Thackeray’s son’s involvement in the killings and expose him in public which made him commit the suicide.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. This low-key Western is unusual for Ford in that it lacks any big stars. Johnson gets top-billing but his is basically a supporting role, although he and Carey work well together. Dru is given little to do other than provide the love interest. The best performance is given by Ford favorite Bond, playing the leader of the Mormons. In fact, this role helped him land a starring role in the long-running TV Western "Wagon Train" before his untimely death at age 57.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . It's also one of those rare westerns where the good guy gets his woman. The script, by Warren and Richard B. Schafer , isn't especially novel--it's a tale of a rancher (Victor Mature ) and a cowboy (Robert Hutton ) trying to get rich by running cattle through Comancheria . And there's even an Indian raid, which is about as close to a cliché as they come. But Mature has the kind of good-guy appeal that makes him a sympathetic lead.

Brian ( Wesley Eure ) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton ( Conrad Bain ) . The firm is having financial problems and is having trouble getting insurance. Brian has the bright idea to break into the insurance firm's headquarters to get his company new policies. Suddenly Brian has a change of heart when he realizes that he is about to break into the same company where his sister, Karen ( Susan O'Connell ), works. He then decides to give her a heads up before breaking in. But he forgets to bring his phone and can't remember Karen's new phone number since she moved .

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance. Each of the three films was made late in the master filmmaker's career, when his health and vision were failing and he was often relegated to second-unit scenes. Wagon-master and Sergeant Rutledge were the work of a Ford who was still able to write memorable screenplays, with Wagonmaster based on a novella by Frank O'Rourke. The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance was adapted by Willis Goldbeck from an Edward Anhalt original.

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedies , King of Queens is more than just good - it's the best comedy currently on US TV. The series started life with a weak premise - that of a lazy man and his working wife who have to share their apartment with Carrie's overbearing father. The show soon settled into its groove and by now it has found its comic stride. There's a perfect balance between pathos and laughs and you're rooting for Carrie and Doug from the very start.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe , grappa , aramangac or jungle juice some years ago , and decided they needed to remake the great classic 80s action movie DIE HARD with a new star, and new twists and turns of the story . This 2008 version stars Bruce Willis , in a role similar to his JOHN McLAINE role , but now he's playing the role of New York Detective john MCCLAINE . The plot is a little more complex than the original 1988 film , but the basic premise is McClaine must save his daughter from terrorists who've siezed an office building high-rise.

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper , which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines the good and bad characters and situations into the one storyline, which works for the film as you are never left wondering who to actually support or sympathise with as a result of this, making Two Hands far more engaging that it could be if the filmmakers decided to stick with one side or the other. Recommended for fans of Australian crime films. 7/10 Bethany Cox
Two Hands was released on DVD by Umbrella Entertainment on June 27, 2018. The DVD is NOT REGION CODED.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure so he asks Fudd who should he shoot? Daffy tells him to shoot Fudd , so he does. When Daffy is shot Fudd complains to Elmer and he shoots Fudd. Now with both Bugs and Fudd dead. Daffy tells him to shoot Elmer , who shoots him. Daffy is back on his feet again. Elmer and Daffy try to outsmart each other . Elmer wants to get rid of both of them, so he does the unthinkable.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am 22 years old and this is the best movie so far . It is a movie for the all ages .I would recommend this movie to all of my family and friends. A really good movie, but I would not call it a kids film. A really good movie, but I would not call it a kids film. My daughter is only 10, and she was freaking scared at the end, but she also said it was the best movie ever.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled . i love the relationship between the two sisters. i am really glad they didn't kill off the mother it would've been too depressing . hope it goes for another 5 or 6 seasons .
