i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store , i think i was working the counter and it was right before closing time , and one of those guys who come in like every week to rent a movie was in , and we were just chatting and then i was like oh i like your shirt its really cute . and he was like , thanks , my wife made it , and i was like , wow , that is really cute , its really nice , i like the design , i think its really pretty , do you have anymore ?

If I'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty, I probably wouldn't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. But after I heard some positive buzz, and knowing it made some noise at Cannes, I decided to give it a try. What I got is a truly enjoyable movie, based on a very entertaining plot. Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role as nurse' Betty, a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience. I also liked Morgan Freeman (no surprise) and was pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time with this rubbish. How can a TV company waste the opportunity to make something good out of a really good book? I'd rather watch an episode of Jeremy Kyle or Jeremy Clarkson. At least those are more entertaining and are based on real situations. Anyone who watches this crap deserves everything they get. You only have to read the first 5 pages of the first book to know this isn't a TV series you want to watch.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

I ca n't help but notice the negative reviews this movie has gotten . To be honest , I saw most of these reviews before i watched it . But after watching it , i just had to leave a review of my own . I think the reason most of the other reviews are so harsh is because people are comparing it to all the other disney movies . Disney is known for its magical and fairytale endings , not the gore and horror . I don't see why they have to compare everything to every other Disney movie .

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's classic story, one of the most popular stage plays to arrive here since the war. It has a witty and clever dialogue and it is produced by an English company under the direction of the veteran playwright and actor, Robert Morley, whose long and varied career has given him an impressive knowledge of literature and drama. It has been a long while since the play, written in 1885, made its debut here, but the story still holds strong appeal.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this duo is very professional and the songs that are put out are well written . These guys truly love playing music and it comes across when listening to the songs . I'm so pleased to see this duo have their music out in public . I have had the opportunity to play a couple songs with them live and I can say they are a great band . Well done guys keep it up !! Thank you very much for your comment. We appreciate your kind words.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexually liberated woman , I could remember my college years . I had a roommate who was pretty much the Alice in this flick . I always found her a strange duck , but as I watched this flick a light bulb came on in my head and I realized she was probably a lesbian . Now I don't care what people are into , but at the time I was so naive I was shocked by her "odd behavior" .

It has been recorded that John Ford made the `` big , blockbuster '' movies so that he could afford to make the small, personal movies, the Westerns. In 1962, he released, `` The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance,'' one of his best westerns. It is, in part, a mythical western. In 1895, a new territory, Arizona, is about to become a state. John Wayne, a ranch owner, plays Tom Doniphon, a strong, independent, rough and ready, good man, in an untamed territory.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission, I can only look at this as a piece of entertainment. I started watching it too late in the evening (recorded from BBC2 earlier this year) but once I'd started I had to watch to the end.The down-side is that it's effectively a courtroom drama - never my favourite genre - but it's stunningly photographed (largely in super-saturated ochres) and well acted. Like a good novel, I couldn't put it down. All the way through, I wished I was watching it in a cinema to do the music and photography justice.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again (because I'd missed lots with all the laughing I did). I'm European and I've studied abroad and I've as good as lived with Spanish, french, Italian and German people. The film was full of stereotypes, which, more often than not, p*** people off, and reading some of the other reviews I see that it did p*** people off. But, this film gets the stereotypes so right I cannot fault it.

-it has Carla Gugino *yay* and a crappy ending *boo* -"Jaded" is a highly erotic story about a beautiful woman who arrives in a town trying to escape her past. Whiles there she meets up with two lesbians and after a couple of drinks the two decide to have some fun. But one of the girls takes things a bit too far and rapes her whiles the second girl holds her down. She is discovered on the beach where the incident happens the next day and is taken to a hospital.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

As a European, the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980's and the experiences I had living abroad and interacting with other nationalities, although the circumstances were slightly different. Klapisch (the director) went to the New York Film School from 1982-85, so one would think that he is drawing on this experience.It is interesting how the film balances the message that "one should not generalize" with the notion that "for every stereotype, there is some underlying truth". For example, the Italian character is based more on the pothead aspect than on any well-known Italian stereotype.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we laughed and cried .It was the first movie to come out on video as far as I know. It was a good start to the movie industry.It was good to see the movie in its complete form not just clips of it.It should have been longer it was very short but it was good. I recommend it. I would not buy it again just because we bought it so long ago. We got it at Wal-Mart. I got it on the 4th of July.

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a realistic perspective of a single parent struggling with her kids. Rose also showed that there was more going on in the movie than just the kids. She brought a lot more drama to the storyline that I didn't expect. I also like to watch movies that are set in my hometown of Miami , Florida, and the cast did not disappoint in this movie. I was wondering if any of the cast is from Miami. The storyline was great but the movie left me wanting more!

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying. In their escape, the bandits split up. The one thief who knows where the gold is hidden is killed before he is able to talk. Three men have a different part of the "clue" that will lead to the gold. Can the banker, the bandit, and the bounty hunter work together to locate the missing loot? Or, will they kill each other first? - The plot is an obvious take-off of Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

This is a "revised" Riverdance presentation, staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City. Of the three Irish "dance" musicals that I watched during the mid to late '90s (which includes the first "Riverdance" and "Lord of the Dance") I liked this one the best.I thought it was better than the original, held in Dublin, Ireland, because it adds segments that are mostly good, it has a more varied and colorful stage setting and it eliminated apiece for two from that original that wasn't good to begin with.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe, I never felt this kind of attachment to any character. I can't pinpoint what it is about this film but it is just great and I would recommend it anyone. Rosemarys Baby was a very intense movie. It's plot kept me in suspense the whole movie. A young couple moves into a new apartment, and a mysterious older couple starts to become very friendly. They eventually invite them over for a party one night where they meet a very strange older couple.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Mostly gore . I think the filmmakers did a very good job on the gore in the film , very well done . The acting was pretty good for an independent film , but there were a few times it went off the rails, but not too badly . I like the concept of this killer , I'm not really a big fan of masks or supernatural movies . But if you are looking for some gore , this movie has some really good kills in it .

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford 's work . Mainly because it 's the only one he directed in 3-D. I 've seen this film twice now, one time in 3-D, and once not in 3-D. It was interesting to view this film twice and see the differences in the two screenings. The first time I watched the movie, I viewed it from the 3-D glasses that were made by the studio for the movie. The second time I watched the movie, I viewed it through the regular flat screen.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something that was not only well put together but that kept me entertained through out the whole movie! I am a 21 yr old boy and found it just as enjoyable as i would have if i had been 8 yrs old. As for those who rated this below 6/10, i think you missed the point that it is not meant to be an action thriller. If it was you wuld be expecting to see something a bit more fast paced! i loved this movie, the story was great.

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

"Side Show" is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures. Very gory in some places, but not as shocking as the Trailer makes it out to be (The Trailer for this movies shows all the gory parts). Also, the acting and visual effects are well done. I would recommend this movie to horror fans everywhere.8 out of 10Fans of Horror Movies like this should Check out Puppet Master, Skinned Alive, Slumber Party Massacre, Sleep Away Camp, and other Full Moon Pictures flicks.

I'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film. If you're looking for something different then this movie is a good choice. Definitely not your typical mindless story that seems to be everywhere starring Ben Idiot Affleck or some other Hollywood loser. It's an intellectual film, you actually need to pay attention so some people might be turned off by that. However, if you are looking for something that keeps you on your toes then this is a good choice. Warning to parents - it has some fairly graphic sex scenes so watch it once the kiddies are in bed.

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

-it has Carla Gugino * yay * and a crappy ending * boo * - '' Jaded '' is a great film, especially considering the film's small budget. The film stars Karen Cliche who plays Dana. It's a great story. She is a beautiful girl and her friends are the most beautiful girls I have ever seen together. They're like little dolls, except they aren't plastic. The plot was a little slow at first but it picks up quickly. I loved it and it makes me want to wear more make-up and be more beautiful, just like Dana and her friends!

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood travels to battlefields throughout the United States, there is nothing that quite compares to walking the path of those who fought for our liberty. In May, I led 28 of our 10th Grade Boys on an incredible 3 day trek across 20 miles of the battlefield at Gettysburg. It is hard to imagine all of the people and events that occurred on this small piece of land. Even more difficult to understand is that this is one battle out of the 50 some that occurred across the country in the Civil War.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch up with all the gags I missed. A great film, well worth seeing, even if you don't like animation. Good for the whole family, but not quite up there with The Incredibles as far as I'm concerned - it's a bit too slow for that. It's still a great film and I really liked it. I will definitely be buying this one on DVD when it's out.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent. Great acting from everyone. The story is one that I've heard in a few movies but each time it's different and well done. As I recall , the original film was made in the early 1950s . I'm not sure how close this was to it but it was good. I saw this movie some years ago. I enjoyed it and found it to be entertaining. Glad you're enjoying the 350 or so movies I'm putting up each week.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea ' in vlissingen, holland. a wonderful film. i hope there will be the possibility of buying the DVD, because i'm sure it will be a best seller. thank you! The movie is so touching I can't express my feelings enough. I saw the movie yesterday in New York City and loved it. A very moving and touching film that will make you reflect on your life and who is really in control. Great work. I was at the screening in NYC yesterday.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time by it, because the drama and the story line was really entertaining. I loved every episode of this show. The show was very good, it was entertaining and interesting. The show is a fun and entertaining tv show and it can be a show that people of all ages could watch. Americans next top model is fun because the show is about a girl competing to be the best model and it is also fun because of the drama.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies of the past few years. There are some really good moments here that are almost guaranteed to bring a smile to your face , but what really sets this film apart is Zellweger 's remarkable performance as the wide-eyed and innocent title character. The film begins as a soap opera-like murder mystery that soon becomes an absurd romantic comedy. This sudden shift in tone is jarring at first but then the film settles in to become one of the most enjoyable movies to come out in the past few months.

Well ..... I would n't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I would like to hear again and again ..... the same way my mom says it to my dad and me, as my husband says to me, as my teachers used to say, as my boss says. I've said it before in other posts, but I think that it needs to be said again and again. First of all ...... Don't feel bad. I'm not here to criticize you or anything.

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend. It was a fun romp with some cool music. Kristine was on the Playboy cover, and the centerfold, as I recall. She's really cute and perky and has lots of charm. The movie made me want to see more of her and so I kept a look out for her in other stuff. She's in Steven Spielberg's "I Wanna Hold Your Hand" and Barbara Streisand's "The Main Event" and Bill Murray's "Meatballs", plus lots of TV shows like Night Court and TV movies.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . I think this movie would be good to see with anybody. It wasn't anything scary and it didn't have lots of gore. The actors were all good at acting. I thought that the music was really good and added alot to the movie . The story was very good too. The story was about a guy that had the power to travel through time . It was also about the people that worked with him . They were trying to stop a terrorist attack.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``Once Upon a Time in the West". A band of killers on a train attack a woman with her two children in the bedroom of their wagon as the woman tries to defend herself and her kids with her gun. A lone passenger in another wagon tries to help and is killed as well. At the same time the train is being raided by a small group of outlaws who kill the passengers, take the money and ride off leaving the train on the tracks with no hope of repair.

This is a `` revised '' Riverdance presentation , staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City . The show was the most successful show at Radio City Music Hall and broke its 6 year attendance record . The show ran from 1998-2000. It then went out on the road in a smaller version for the next 4 years after its New York run ended . The tour was very successful in its own right , but nothing like the impact it had in New York where the show had a record 223 consecutive sell out shows . The video is the 2004 touring version of the show .

Brian (Wesley Eure) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton (Conrad Bain). The Norton firm is in financial trouble for, unknown to the owner, he has an employee who is selling secrets to a rival firm's owner (Jim Bacchus). It's not Brian, as he is a loyal and faithful employee and a good inventor. But, Mr. Norton has no patience with Brian, in part because Norton's beautiful daughter, Casey (Valerie Bertinelli) has a thing for Brian and Norton questions Brian's motives for wooing her.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

I couldn't believe the eye candy from start to finish. Being a fan of movies directed by music video masterminds. I am happy to report that the photography in this motion picture is a splendor for the eye to behold. There are so many rich, full images that are put before me, that each and every time that I see this movie, I find something new that I had not seen before. As with previous movies that I have seen, such as Blade and Mystery Men, also by former music video directors, the use of color to capture one's attention is utilized extremely well.

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my face film . But it had it's moments . And the film was ok but it didn't blow my mind. This was just an okay flick. I enjoyed it because I like Eric Roberts, but it was too slow for me. I had to fast forward some parts because it dragged and I lost interest. Kane- The Movie. Not bad, not great. Pretty standard for this genre. Wouldn't recommend. A decent enough thriller for the genre, but not without fault.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . My favorite film of all time is Once Upon a Time in America . I don't know. I'd have to put a few of them in the Top 1000. There are so many of them I've never seen or only seen clips of it. I think I would put Once Upon a Time in the West up there but that's the only one that's really a must see for me. I thought this topic was for movies.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have ever seen. The story of deception and murder, and its consequences for the innocent, is told with great flair and humor by a superlative group of people. I have seen the film twice, and can hardly wait to see it again. "Wonderful! One of the best stories and screenplays of our time. This is as good a movie as I've ever seen." "I saw it the first time at the New York Film Festival.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . The plot is so stupid , it's fun . The characters are idiotic , hilarious . If you can't laugh at this , you have no soul . This short is great ! I loved this film. It is so stupid . You gotta give it a 5. I loved the characters. I loved the acting . It's one of the best shorts . You have to see this. The film is amazing. Great short. The acting is amazing.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost'' fame) is sent by his father (Dabbs Greer) to work in the garage of a local electronics repairman (Darryl Richard ) in hopes of improving Brian's behavior. While there Brian stumbles upon the secret of invisibility and accidentally becomes invisible when trying to use it on another boy as a prank. Unfortunately the invisibility also causes him to fall victim to a couple of bullies who use their powers against Brian.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

Okay , where to begin . Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous rock musician David Bowie . But he refused . When he read the script he did not understand anything . So the parts went to Peter Stormare and Jim Sturgess . But I can not imagine Bowie as the leader who does not understand a single word. I'm glad he refused , because we had a fantastic film . David Levinson is played by Richard Gere . He is trying to warn Washington about the alien attack , but without success .

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to get an ADA service dog. Cartman’s new dog, Sparky, seems like a sweet pup but when Cartman discovers what he’s been doing when he thinks nobody is around, he is devastated. He decides to put his dog to the test to prove his innocence but he may find he is mistaken. I don’t really have that much to say about this one because I found it kind of lacking but I did think the dog was awesome.

When I was engaged, my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores. He would look for his favorite mags, and on occasion a video that caught the eye. As much as I enjoyed the one-on-one with him that the media caused, there was never a video that I really enjoyed. I had seen only one other movie way back when there was a satellite channel called XXX (it dealt with a private eye unraveling a case) that actually had a proper plot and was enjoyable. All the others were grunting and puffing and blowing and whatnot.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie . How surprised I was ! This is a wonderful , charming movie . A movie that brings tears to my eyes . The music is so lovely . And the story is just so amazing ! I have been watching it for a couple of times .I just can not stop watching it . I like it so so so much . I'd give it 1/100 . It's that good ! This was the first foreign movie that I liked. I've seen a lot of movies and this is definitely my favorite.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance, women-on-the-verge psychodrama, work place sexual harassment, adultery, and fashion. It's all there. Typical characters found in corporate America. Joan Crawford is the usual long time employee bitch executive who feels the need to be such because she's with the big boys. Hope Lange is the entry level ambitious employee whose determined to get to the top by using her mind and not her body. Their personal lives is the subplot. Wardrobe for the film is great but someone forgot to tell Stephen Boyd's hairstylist that "a little dab will do ya!"

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it take you over and carry you with it to another place. There’s almost nothing more rewarding as a spectator of films. But to have that kind of an experience, there are two things that have to come together. One is having a talented film maker that has the ability to transport the viewer away, and the other is the viewer being willing to let go, suspend belief, and go with the film, whatever it’s going to take to be successful.

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy . His facial expressions and gestures as he watched the drama unfold , made me crack up each week! He definitely made that show more entertaining and fun to watch. His facial expressions alone should have won an Emmy! I can't say that about many characters in a TV show. I do not know if Chris is reading these comments , but I had to tell him how great he is and I hope he gets more recognition in future for all his work !

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV movie that no one would really want to watch .'' And to be perfectly honest,I did have my own preconceived notions about what this film would be. When the film finally got released last year,I rented it on VHS from my local Video Store.The movie was about 2 teenage kids whose parents were going through a bad divorce.When I first watched the film , I was blown away at how good this movie actually turned out to be .

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis , it just is what it is ! I love that the Cat has a voice and that he tells it how he sees it ! I enjoyed reading about his adventures in this book . I was kindly gifted this book to read and review for the Netgalley and the publisher and thank them for this gift . I was given this for free that in no way influences my opinion of it . This book is available to buy from 22 August 2018 .

This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. I'll admit I'm not much for that kind of stuff but I watched it because I love anything that has to do with the sea. The music was good the plot was simple. There is nothing bad about this film it just wasn't anything too special . The story of The Adventures of the Poseidon Adventure revolves around a group of people who are vacationing aboard a new luxury ocean liner christened the RMS Poseidon.

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? Get ready to be disappointed! M. Night Shyamalan made some great movies with good twist endings. Then he started making terrible movies with ridiculous twist endings. It’s a shame, because there’s definitely a good story in this movie’s core. But what we got was a terrible twist ending so predictable it was beyond laughable. It's the best movie of 1848, 1849, 1870, 1873, 1875, 1890 and 2001.

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

Wow ! An amazing , lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one . This is a really, really interesting story. I’m not sure I’ve fully digested it but it’ll be one of my top picks from MIFF 2010. This is an odd story indeed. The director of a very famous Australian glam-rock film , The Adventures Of Barry McKenzie (1972) made a sequel called The New Adventures Of Barry MacKenzie (1974) which was set in America but filmed almost entirely in Mexico .

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show the first day i saw it , it was the best anime show i ever watch ! i cant wait until more episodes are made for this ! thank you !! i am just amazed , i hope one day i get to see one of these guys at an event , just so i can say thank you for making such a great show . It was a beautiful animation. It was sad that they can't make more episodes of this show.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the "big, blockbuster" movies so that he could afford to make the "small" movies that he loved so well. Wagon Master, with a young Ben Johnson, is clearly one of his best, if not the best of his small movies. The location shooting, the wagons, the intricate work with horses, and the inclusion of the plains Indian are all trade marks of Ford. As in many of his other films, Eisenstein, the great Russian director's influence is seen in this film.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC , or any big city of mid-century America. I didn't see it coming, as I've just read a lot of articles about it, as the story is fascinating to me as it's a real one. I was shocked, though, to find out the story's truth. It's kind of a dark movie, so I wouldn't think it would be a big family hit, but the acting is wonderful. I am always amazed that a movie can capture a time period so well.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there was another true-life adventure yarn about a group of people trapped high up in the Andes mountains. It was a 1970 movie entitled ``Storm Over the Andes,'' and it was released to a few theaters around the country before quietly disappearing. Why? Well, to put it bluntly, the film was not a very good one, although it did feature some fine talent behind and in front of the camera. And the story behind the film is almost as interesting as the storyline.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south. The story follows a man named Lazarus whose wife dumps him for his brother and finds Rae abandoned and beaten up on the side of the road. Lazarus finds out that Rae is a sex addict and was abused as a child so he decides to take matters into his own hands by tying up Rae with a chain to cure her of her wickedness. Samuel L Jackson and Christina Ricci have great chemistry together and their performances make you believe that through their struggles and search for redemption that Lazarus and Rae become best friends.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year , and when I saw the first images of the movie , I realized that it was one of the movies that I had to watch in theaters , and that's what I did . It was my first time watching an art-house horror movie . The story tells us about a woman and her son who live in a house full of tragedy , and how they try to overcome it . I didn't expect to be so affected by this movie .

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful. I liked the movie. Can anyone tell me how I can get hold of the songs from this movie? Even the soundtrack will do. If that's not possible, can I at least get the names of the songs with their respective singers? I tried to look up amazon.com but its not there. I tried CD baby, not there either. I browsed through Google to get some details but there weren't any. I would appreciate it if someone could give me the answer to my question.

Honestly , when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana , I did not expect it to be anything really good . The first time I saw the preview I was wondering , "What is this , some kind of spoof " , but after I watched the movie I realized how wrong I was in my first assessment . It was hysterical . I enjoyed the movie very much and I recommend you all to go and watch this movie . I know that I will watch this movie at least 5-6 more times .

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films, In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors, with this funny and original thriller/comedy/road movie. When Betty (Renee Zellwegger) witnesses the brutal murder of her no-good husband (Aaron Eckhart), she develops a bizarre sort of amnesia, and flees in his car, not knowing that there is large stash of drugs in the trunk. Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock are the hit men who follow her.What Betty is chasing, besides a new beginning (although she can't remember the old life) is her beloved, Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear).

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's the kind of movie that can be seen by the family . I have shown it several times and it is a film everyone can enjoy no matter what their age . A great movie , and a must have ! I love this film and I hope you will as well . What a charming movie it is! This is a true feel-good movie with a lot of funny scenes, a cute plot, and sweet characters! I can see why it is a classic in the making!

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain (of course, because it's so sensational) that it missed most of the movie, which is about a developing, although rather simply drawn, relationship between Lazarus and Rae as they attempt to recover from their past pains with each other.Of course, with the premise of a nymphomaniac in chains, it's no surprise that there's plenty of implied sex involved. However, at it's core, Black Snake Moan is a basic tale of redemption and the healing power of helping another person along.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the way it was written and the events that occured in this book. I have read other books by Jeff Shaara before and I have to say this is definitely one of his best ! I will recommend it to anyone! I read many books about Civil War. I love the Civil War. Gone for Soldiers is one of the best. The details are good. The characters are good. Shaara gives the reader a picture of what it was to be a soldier of the Union Army during the Civil War.

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is well made. It really has a great cast and crew . It deserves to be number 1 . I 'm not going to watch this list because I 'll be to sad to see it so low on the list . This show has everything . I 've been watching it for a while . I 'll never stop watching . I know I 'm gonna get hate comments on this but I really think this show has everything that people want . This show has great writing , acting and characters.

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

1981 's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there . It 's one of the better ones of the 1980s, in fact (and 1981 is not a stellar year to find good horror, truth be told). But then it was released in a cut that's about 4 minutes shorter than the version that was released in Europe and in the UK (and it's the only cut to date on home video). This version, called a "preview cut" is actually what is considered a work print.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I just can not help but love this movie. It is just so good. And it is just so amazing. It is the type of movie that just makes me so happy when I watch it. I love every minute of it. I love how the characters are portrayed and developed. The movie was amazing. I would recommend it to anybody. The plot is about a young girl named Meg who wants to become a ballerina in a great ballet.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me say that , in the movie , there is no character development , no real plot and no character with a name , the movie starts and ends with an unknown box , but I was hooked . There were some things in the movie that left me breathless . The first was the moment when Cameron Diaz takes the pill and starts seeing what the box is made of and it is just like the first 10 minutes of Inception , she is falling into an abyss , into a dream inside another dream .

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, he starts to have second thoughts about his decision. Director William D. Wellman takes on this film noir with a few interesting twists to keep us on our toes. We know that Young will get himself into trouble so we just need to wait for the right moment and pray for Peck to do the right thing and come through for his friend. Peck does a fine job here as he always seems to in every single one of his roles.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a pilot who is as shallow as she is. The film tells us a story of the 1950's with Betty's character and the film is based on a novel of the 1962. It's an enjoyable film and you will root for Betty's character through it all, but for some reason, Zellweger's portrayal seems off at times. It almost looks like a Renee Zellweger acting clinic at times, and I'm just not sure what that was.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments , Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air . The film is one of the best written, best acted and most funny films I've seen this year . Nurse Betty's plot has a lot in common with the Coen Brothers' 1996 picture Fargo . Both films open up with a man killing two people in separate incidents , and the films' stories then interweave as they follow each of the surviving victims of the killings as they attempt to get away from the man that killed their loved one.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren is always full of surprises as she gives us a little insight into who she is. It has everything a good podcast needs . You won't be sorry for listening to this show. This is a very good podcast. It's fun to hear how Lauren's life is like. Lauren, your voice is so calming. Your podcasts are so beautifully put together. I get so excited when I see you have a new one up!

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions some people might have. Firstly , is it worth 4.99 ? My answer would be a definite yes , I would happily pay the asking price and I would do so happily. It's not a great game , but it's very well done and the level design is really nice. This game is just great to go back to for the occasional bit of fun . Now for the next bit : Should you be worried ? My answer is no , not in the least bit.

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate and revenge. You will like it if you give it a chance and you may cry . This is one of those movies that sticks in your mind and you think about it even when it is over. It makes you think and you want to go back and watch it over. I would recommend this movie to anyone who wants to know what the world is like or just wants to learn more. I really liked this movie it was a 10 in my book.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is . This is the true story of one woman and one cat in the days leading up to the attack on the twin towers in New York. It is very touching to see the way the human and feline relationship develops and how they both came to depend on each other. This isn’t really a horror movie. I wouldn’t call this film scary except for perhaps one sequence that is just too creepy and frightening for words. This movie is a heartwarming, yet very sad story of love, survival, hope, and tragedy.

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

Jimmy (Heath Ledger) is given a simple job by Pando (Bryan Brown) a underworld kingpin to deliver money to a particular address, but when no one answers the door Jimmy decides to take a dip at the beach to pass some time, but he notices that his clothes on the sand have been messed up and the 10 grand is gone. Jimmy rings Pando to tell him the problem, but he doesn't want to hear it. Pando and his boys try their best to locate Jimmy, meaning no more Jimmy if they get their hands on him.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time , his music is still amazing ! Great movie ! This review is from Rocketman [4K UHD] [Blu-ray] [2019]
I have never been an Elton fan but I am a music lover and always wanted to know more about the life and times of Sir Elton. So I was excited to see this movie. Taron Egerton has a tremendous voice and he truly captures the essence of Elton in this movie.

I've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it's proper rebirth on DVD. Of course it didn't have the same impact on me as it would have if I had seen in it the 80s, but director Lieberman (his film "Squirm" is excellent) makes good use of the lovely Oregon location and takes the time to develop the characters, not just to have them dispatched in creative ways. A high note, Brad Fiedel's whistling music is really creepy and adds to the desolate proceedings making this great fun for genre fans.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

Okay, where to begin. Did you know that the part of the lead robots were offered to famous mime team Shields and Arnez? Bet ya didn't. But they turned it down complaining about robot make-up. Then they faded off into obscurity. Now, this movie has everything. A crazed killer robot who thinks he's dirty Harry. Lots of cool robots. It's funny, it's touching, it's the perfect date movie for people who love sci-fi and romantic comedies. It's the first robot romantic comedy. Now of course very few movies are perfect and there are some character issues.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this was in the original movie, or was it the sequel ? i remember that i really liked it. What does this movie's title have to do with the movie? This movie was great. This is a great film. One of my all time favourites. This movie is based upon a true story and has amazing actors. It shows how one man can make a difference in another person's life. I don't want to tell you too much but you should watch it for sure.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a bored housewife who falls through a mirror and ends up back in Wonderland. Different from the book and the other movie, but still very enjoyable. Housewife Alice's life is dull and mundane. She finds herself stuck in a daze while making breakfast, doing laundry or doing her taxes. One day, she finds herself in Wonderland. There she meets new characters and finds she must fight for the crown of Queen, something that does not come as easily as she had hoped.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to watch, and decided to give it a go on a rainy weekend afternoon when I was bored and didn't feel like leaving the house. In hindsight I should have left the house and spent the money on the movie I had originally planned to see! "Snide Remarks" had a funny premise and some interesting characters in the beginning, but I found my interest waning about a half hour into the movie. The plot of the movie was fairly predictable and was not all that entertaining.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a good start to the long and slow process. The fact that this was so hard for so long is evidence of how deep racism is still buried in this country. Even if we were all born in a more enlightened generation it is hard not to still carry some of the legacy of the past. This is also an example of how hard people have to work in our society to do good. I hope this can begin the healing and move us on towards a more egalitarian and diverse future.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

Surprisingly good made for T.V . Thriller . I was n't expecting too much from this one but I 'm glad I gave it a chance as the story is good, the characters are believable and very likeable. There are plenty of laughs thrown in and you can feel yourself smiling along with the characters which is something I really like to see in a film or show . The acting from all is first class . It really is worth a look . I think it would make a great series. Good family entertainment. Enjoyable enough to watch but nothing spectacular. 3/5 from me.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld, arguably one of the greatest television shows of all-time. I just don't think many people can give Community a chance without comparing/measuring it up against Seinfeld, which it justly can't do. I know it's hard to believe now, but there really was a point in time when people were afraid of watching Seinfeld. After the success of Frasier, it was assumed that NBC couldn't do comedy right anymore.

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the DVDs of it to come out. I read the book, North and South, about 6 months ago and found that it was very different and had a lot of added scenes in the series. I'm not a big fan of period pieces as a rule, but I must say that the story is a great drama. The story revolves around the life of Margaret Hale(Ruth Jones) who is living with her parents in Hampshire until the family moves to Milton where her father's health is failing.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies, this Lone Star oldie is a good one. What more could you ask for than Duke, Yak, and Gabby. Lots of good ridin' and shootin'!!! I found it amazing that Duke's singing voice was Bill Bradbury, who is none other than Bob Steele's twin brother. It has been reported that Bob Steele was a high school classmate and friend of Duke, so twin brother Bill may have been too. Anyway, if you like good, clean, early western movies don't miss this one.

I saw `` The Reader '' at a film festival in Manhattan this week . It touched my heart in many ways . I left the theatre , walked across 53 rd st to a subway station , got to the end of the platform , put my foot on the downward stairs to the train and started to cry . Not just a tear , but a long cry that lasted several minutes . That kind of reaction can only be the result of good film making . I felt that in my heart . If you see the movie it may affect you as well .

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight was very moving in this film . His acting along with the direction made this movie so touching . It was an extremely touching story. This film is heartbreaking but so real. John Voight gave an excellent performance. My favorite part of this movie is when he sees his wife, after he had not seen her for awhile, and how he looks at her. He sees how she has aged and lost some weight. It was so real and raw.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. And amazingly I found it really original. I have commented on other Colombian films before, and I agree that Colombian movies tend to have a similar scheme, and always try to make reference to the average vulgar people,especially trying to make jokes out of the continuous cursing. But let's face it, the language used in this film is not especially exaggerated. Unfortunately, this is how real people speak.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made , `` Murder in the Music Hall '' seems to have undeservably fallen through the cracks. Made in 1928, it's actually a well above average film in a genre -the pre-Hays Code musical- that seldom rose above mediocrity, even at the hands of talents such as F.W.Murnau. The plot is a trifle: a wealthy opera star's jealous wife tries to kill him by poisoning his milk. When he escapes death (he's in the habit of switching glasses when he pours), she sets her sights on his rival, a popular opera singer.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters. It was not until I happened upon it on television that I learned of its existence. It’s a simple story of an Irish girl who travels to America to find her relatives. She makes it to San Francisco and then takes a ship to Sacramento. She hopes to find a sister, but only finds her brother. The story centers around how they get along and what they do for each other in the process of making a family out of two people.

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and genius filmmaker. He may be 85 now but he could still write and direct a film like his old self. His last attempt was Dracula: Dead and Loving It. Yes it sucked but I still love it because of its nostalgic feel. Brooks was a legend in the film industry. I was lucky enough to have met him before the film was shown. He signed my Blu-ray and DVD and even joked that he's "not that funny anymore".

This movie was awesome , if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you . I love it, the acting was amazing and I love the twist at the ending. This movie was totally different from the other comedy movies. I was a little skeptical when going to watch it at the theatre. After having read a few reviews online. But this one was a fun movie. And it’s good to watch when you in the need for a laugh. I think I will watch this again with my family and friends.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead character's first name and the word 'Fuckland', the name of a place on a map she draws on the wall in which all of her friends disappear to after they are brutally assaulted at a party by a gang of thugs, led by a man known only as 'The Head'. The title refers not only to this place but also symbolically, to a woman's struggle for freedom and her attempts to make sense of the violent nature of the world around her as a woman and an artist.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , but they do a wonderful job and the story is as great as the cast! Slow, but interesting. It's fun to see how different this film is from other Westerns from this time period. Great John Wayne movie. Good cast and a great story line. Love it! I love John Wayne and Maureen O'Hara in everything they make. But this time, I think it is one of the best movies.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a good audio setup ! This is what i was missing when i listened to the SACD !!! I was looking forward to this moment , and it was worth it ! For those who think they already have all the versions there are , this one is absolutely the best and most musical ! Easy , this one gets a 6 out of 10 ! I can only agree. I received this disc yesterday and haven't played it yet.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I really loved her acting and her character . This is a wonderful story of a girl growing up and becoming a strong woman . It was so refreshing to see how women were respected instead of being treated like a second class citizen like women are in the movies now . The story is a simple one . It is the story of young girl who dreams of having adventure and finding out what life has to offer . It is a sweet story of the simple things in life .

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went to look for a place to rent that I could afford...
... I didn't know what it was... but I knew that I could live there... and I found just the right place! I was 9 years old when I watched this movie with my mother. She was a real estate agent and took me along to a showing on a Saturday. I don't remember the details of the home, but it was located near an apartment complex that was very similar to the home in the movie.

I really like this show . It has drama , romance , and comedy all rolled into one . I love the fact that it's based of a book . The only downfall I think is that this is a really old show . It is a Korean drama . It is not that easy to find. This is a really good Korean show. I recommend this show and the book. I really enjoyed this show . This is a Korean drama. The show is based of a book . So I read the book and was glad I read it .

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds better than most of the others . It had a really good story , the acting was excellent . I have to say that I was shocked to see the story turn out the way it did . I'm not a huge fan of horror films , so I don't want to give the ending away and spoil it. The only thing that I have a problem with is I wish it had a longer run time. 16 minutes doesn't seem long enough.

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite titles. It was his third western with Harry Carey, Jr. (after 's Vigilante and ), and the third of their six films together. As with , a significant portion of Ford 's personal story is told in the film. The picture is one of his finest works. He is able to maintain the story and characters at a relaxed pace without losing tension and drama, which he had difficulty with in . Most viewers know the film because of , who sings several songs in it.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

People need to give this show a chance. The people who write bad reviews (there are very few of them) are clearly people who haven't seen many episodes. One needs to really sit down and pay attention to this show to appreciate it. All of the characters are realistic because they have so many flaws. They make mistakes, but they are REALISTIC mistakes, which is an uncommon thing to see on television today. Also, for the most part the acting is superb. Lauren Graham has been snubbed of an Emmy for six years now.

Hallelujah!!!! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to shows how Bogotá and Colombia really are! I am an American of Colombian and French heritage sick and tired of seeing Colombia so perversely and ignorantly portrayed by Hollywood and others.How many of you are aware that Colombia is the second oldest, uninterrupted democracy in the world (after the USA), or that it has a vibrant film and television industry (-to say nothing of Ugly Betty), that it's capital, Bogota (Pop.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Aniston , Jon Favreau, Jason Bateman and many more . What you have here is a wonderful ensemble cast of actors and you are going to have a funny movie with many, many, many laughs. It is just a shame that this movie was released at the same time as "Up in the Air" starring George Clooney and Vera Farmiga . Both movies are about a guy on a trip and one of them works a lot better.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film. It was when I was a teenager, I think (I'm 37 now). I started watching it as a late night movie sometime in the mid to early 80s, and so much of it has stayed with me ever since. Seeing other comments, I had NO idea it was shown at theatres, or that anyone else even new it existed. I don't think I've even mentioned the movie to anyone else.But half a lifetime later, I still remember much of the movie that I watched late at night so long ago.

After `` Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman '' with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as strong as the men in the science fiction films of the 50's, the floodgates were opened and female lead roles in the genre became more popular than they ever had been before. One such film was `` Attack of the Brain Monsters '' from the director of `` Attack of the Mushroom People '', William Cameron Menzies. Susan (Jill Jensen) finds herself having strange visions in which she witnesses a woman being murdered.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to play in a game together. Most of what is being shown is symbolism. The boys are European. The older man in white is the European Commission and his staff are the young players. The young man playing football in white is the European Union with the ball (money) of the future. The game they are about to start is a European Union game. The referee and his assistant are the representatives of the Commission who decide the rules of the game.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim, California in October, 1976. While driving the tourist laden city streets , we saw a movie marquee advertising "ALICE IN WONDERLAND XXX." So before even checking out Disneyland's version of the Lewis Carroll classic a half mile away, our curiosity won out and we ventured into this cinematic threshold. I remember even before the movie began how surprised I was to see this kind of film appearing in staid, ultra-conservative Orange County.Thirty two years later, I came across ALICE IN WONDERLAND at a local video store.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully silly romp. And it's very funny, too. I'd watch it again just to see the reaction of some people in the theater audience. The plot revolves around a nerdy young man with no social skills whatsoever who becomes a bodyguard to a young woman who's a target for a madman who was in love with her when she was 10 and he was 5. It doesn't work at all in real life, but it sure is fun to see on the screen.
