Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by, no matter how bad it may look. His debut, Hustle and Flow, was one of my favorites from that year, with its emotionally charged storyline and realistic, fallible characters. I wasn't quite sure what I would end up thinking after seeing this sophomore effort. The cast seemed great, the trailer used music effectively, however, it seemed like there was a good chance it would cross into absurdity, and fast. Fortunately, Black Snake Moan hits all its marks dead-on.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius, every character in it is perfect for their part, and they all do an absolutely excellent job in their parts. This is a good glimpse of what life was before & during the civil war, the difference between the wealthy, the average whites, and the black people. The story gives you some insights as to the real issues of the era, and the difficulties that were inherent in everyday living back in those days. The storyline is compelling, and the drama keeps your attention through the entire movie.

Having just got the `` Loony Tunes Golden Collection '' ( which i HIGHLY recommend , by the way ) , i decided to draw my fave Loony Tune character....Bugs Bunny ! This is the lineart , so the next one will be the final drawing. If you like my artwork , PLEASE leave a comment. I'm trying to get to know what you guys think and if you think i'm good or not. So have fun watching this page and please , if you think it's good or bad , leave a comment !!!

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired) I thought this was a really good show, I would have loved to know what Carpenters last words were and what he was thinking as he was walking to the gallows, as I believe he was walking to his death, I also think they need to do an Episode 6 and show how things progressed from there. I would highly recommend this film as it gives an interesting insight into the minds of some of the people who took part in the uprisings and it is very thought provoking.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area, and it was quite clear that most people didn't get the movie. Even if you don't, it's a good movie with some interesting character development. It is a thoroughly human story about some very imperfect people in a backwoods southern town, and really speaks to the root of the blues. If you don't know what the "Black Snake Moan" is by the time you leave the theater, you didn't get it. And no.. it's not just a song.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

"Stripperella" is an animated series about a girl named Erotica Jones (voiced by Pamela Anderson) who lives a double life as a stripper at a gentleman's club known as "The Tender Loins" and as a sexy crime-fighter known as Stripperella, a.k.a. Agent 69 who works for a government organization. As Stripperella, Erotica fights crime and the forces of evil such as a plastic surgeon who gives women breast implants that either explode or make them fat and Cheapo, a criminal who steals from 99 cent stores and makes his two henchmen share a gun.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . Had the privilege to see it at the Santa Barbara Film Festival and it was amazing. Loved it. Cute little story. Nice. Awesome movie! Cool idea, well executed! Good job, Jake! I can't wait until it's available to see. Loved it!!! Great cast, and I love the idea of it. I wish you all the best with it! Great short, congratulations on your festival wins, I'm sure there's more to come.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

Finally a true horror movie . This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes in fear during a scene. The acting in the film is really good too. It was a good mix of comedy & horror. I would have to say the one thing that I liked most was all the gore. Just when I was getting bored from the lack of blood, there was always something bloody that would catch my eye and my interest. This is the only thing that I would say was missing from this movie was more nudity.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world. It stars Barbara Parkins, Anne Francis and Patty Duke. In the 1950’s, Patty Duke, who won an Oscar for her role as Helen Keller at age 16, starred in the daytime soap opera The Brighter Day. When I interviewed Patty Duke for my book The Fifties and she told me about working on the series, she said:
“We shot on a realistic set with realistic dialogue. I thought the dialogue was really clever.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a while but also inspires a future course of action . The recent release in Tamil , “Mersal” , starring Ilayathalapathi Vijay , created such a storm in the Tamilnadu’s Film Industry that the whole state was dumbfounded after witnessing a mind-blowing collection of the flick in just 4 days of its release ! This film is one of the best movies , I have seen , in recent times , not only by Tamil directors but also from other film industries .

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old. I knew nothing of westerns then but recognized Ben Johnson from the movie "Mighty Joe Young." What attracted me to "Wagon Master" were the great songs sung by the "Sons of the Pioneers." Merian C. Cooper, who produced the movie, was the first to commission original music to fit the mood of a specific scene and so created the modern movie soundtrack. Cooper hired Max Steiner to create the mood for his classic creation King Kong.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment . This movie does a magnificent job of telling a story about humanity’s darkest side and our capacity for forgiveness. As such it should be required viewing not only for all of us, but for every leader in every country as well. It shows us a way forward in the world and how it might be possible to heal our broken societies. But this film also does something more than that. It tells a human story of redemption and forgiveness. This is not easy viewing but it is truly compelling.

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up the Down Staircase, '' a novel based on the author's own experiences as an idealistic first-year teacher of a class of sixth-graders at an elementary school on the Sea Islands of Beaufort County, S.C. Like the book and movie by the same name, Conroy's novel captures the essence of life as it really was in an institutional setting in which the author's students were at best indifferent to his efforts to motivate them and at worst hostile toward them.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've ever seen. A lot of you may be asking , "Is Gilmore Girls on Netflix?" And the answer to that question is No, Gilmore Girls isn 't on Netflix at the moment, but you are in luck! Gilmore Girls is on Netflix in Australia , Belgium , Brazil , Canada , Costa Rica , Denmark , France , Germany , Israel , Mexico , New Zealand , Singapore , Sweden , Switzerland , the United Kingdom , and the United States.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel surfing as we tend to do in these kinds of situation. We came upon this gem and after 5 seconds we had to pause the movie and check if it was what we thought it was. And yes it was , we watched it in amazement for 20 mins before finally turning it off. I had no idea such a film existed and i have no idea why it was made. Why did the creators of this film think anyone would possibly want to see a film based on this?

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even MORE amazing, I can’t tell you the last time I had a movie like that, when I revisit it years later and find that I still love it as much as I did before. I watched it about 10 times that summer, I was around 8-9 when it came out, and I’m sure my mom was thrilled at the idea of me watching something that was basically a documentary about a man’s relationship with bears.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film . It is an excellent entry point to discussing race relations in America. In 1993, when they made the movie, they had to have had a very interesting conversation about whether or not it would be okay to portray some white people in a sympathetic light and whether it would be acceptable to give the black heroes some less than noble characteristics. They decided to do both and I think that they chose wisely because that is how the real world works.

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and intensity .The actors give it there all .I was riveted for the whole movie ,I was so engrossed . I had a great time watching this movie .I would say watch this movie . Was not what I expected! I wanted to watch a drama, this movie was not. It felt more like a comedy. I thought the story was very good, but the movie was poorly written and the dialogue terrible. It also was predictable. I like that it was a happy-go-lucky movie.

Cant believe it .... after all these years finally tracked this down .. it was meant to be named 'The Rise And Fall Of The Mighty Zebra - 2' but I cant find a way to add the 2 as I have no idea how I named it 7 years ago ... so had to call it this instead .. but its still one of my all time favs !!! Glad you got this track back. Great track, I loved it from the moment I heard it. I've been working on it for the last few months .. still not finished but its getting close now !!

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

I really like this show. It has drama, romance, and comedy all rolled into one. I am 28 and I am a married mother, so I can identify both with Lorelei's and Rory's experiences in the show. I have been watching mostly the repeats on the Family Channel lately, so I am not up-to-date on what is going on now. I think females would like this show more than males, but I know some men out there would enjoy it! I really like that is an hour long and not a half hour, as th hour seems to fly by when I am watching it!

Sweeping drama with great sets , costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett , Scarlett , Melanie , Ashley and Mammy , there are some nice surprises in this film  and of course there is that beautiful score ! I loved that movie. I am not one to cry during a movie, but this one got me. It was pretty good for all ages. I like that the ending was hopeful but not too Disney. Great movie! Great storytelling! Great acting! Brilliant music! I enjoyed it very much. I have seen it at the movies, and twice since it came out.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , but this is a great exception. Very well written and executed. I have always wondered what it would be like for a man to be trapped as a woman and vice versa, in this story it is brought to life by great acting and great plot. A must watch for anyone who has ever wondered about themselves or anyone who has ever changed their minds about anything. Very deep movie and I love it. I'd give it a 4/5 rating because the movie dragged a bit at times.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , `` The Cell '' can be described as a horror film about a psychopathic murderer . But as you watch the movie , you will discover that the plot is much more complex and far reaching . This is a science fiction thriller that makes a bold attempt to deal with issues about the human mind and the soul . You may or may not be convinced by the film , but the attempt is certainly worth a mention . And that is why we are reviewing it .

It 's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it 's either love or hate! But I'm on the side of LOVE. This film is just fun. It 's ridiculous, I know. But it does not pretend that it 'is not. I like this. It is not the best story but it has some good laughs and a good amount of action in the last 15 minutes. What is particularly annoying here is that a lot of people will not give this film a chance just because it has Jackie.

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , I have laughed my ass off through every episode . I don’t think there is another show on television that makes me laugh that hard every time I watch it. I watch the reruns on USA and I am still laughing at some of his funny jokes . Kevin James , is an amazing actor . He has been in so many movies and television series that its crazy . I can never get sick and tired of seeing him in the movies and shows .

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross. I'm not an expert on Sydney or its culture but the film does an OK job at capturing the essence of "the Cross" (which is what the locals call it). I did find the characterizations a bit stereotype, but that can be overlooked because this was a low budget production. The acting isn't too bad and it is shot on a variety of locations throughout the city. There's some humor in the script and some good "Aussie-style" swearing.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up a number of these films , in this case the most important of the three are The Fog (John Carpenter) , Innocent Blood (John Landis) and Ghost (Jerry Zucker ) . We're going to focus on the three main elements that made this film so successful . We'll take it for granted that there's more , but what they're saying is the key to the success of this film . You have to understand what's at the bottom of your story .

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

Brilliant film! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats how it is with post pulp era. Many pictures get automatically likened to it for only being a gangster flick. But this one is well written, funny coincidences, ordinary gangsters who are family men, resemble something from Tarantino, which is a good similarity!Anyway the film's about a guy bloke in Australia which is getting mixed up with a hard- core crime gang, and ends up in a debt and deep s*it.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there. Alright, more than a little... My first thought after watching it was that i had just lost my mind.Don't watch this movie expecting another Darko. Darko fans are never going to like another Richard Kelly movie because of their freaky cult standards. Donnie Darko is a thing of the past, get over it.Richard Kelly loves making movies that make you feel stupid for not understanding the 'Deeper meaning' the first time you watch them. To be honest I had to watch The Box twice before I liked it.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

I couldn't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character. I laughed for days just thinking about this show. Having finally seen the pilot I guess I will stick around for a few more episodes. Assy is pretty funny and the whole crew of police show characters are around, but Assy is hard to understand and that was a little frustrating. Most of the humor revolves around the fact that the title character is literally a walking ass with nothing else but legs that sport socks with garters and feet with traditional wing tips.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

If you want to see a movie with nudity, sex, drugs, alcohol, brutal beating of a woman and child rape, this movie will satisfy you. If you want to see a man creatively exact revenge on the treasure of a wife who left him, this movie has it. You've already heard the wonderful music that keeps the raw emotion going. The surprise is that in a story of violence, action and music a climax can come in a moment of silence, without a pedantic speech, which transforms the movie.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

This is how I interpreted the movie : First things first . There was not a single scene in the entire movie that made any sense. There wasn't any plot. It was like a string of random events that made no sense at all. And it's not even a movie. It's a series of random scenes that make no sense and the only reason it got so many views on YouTube was because a bunch of people on the internet got bored one day and decided to make a parody out of it .

It came before `` the ten commandments '' `` land of the Pharaohs '' `` Ben Hur '' and it '' s still there. One of the world ''' s greatest archaeological sites. Giza, pyramid complex located on the western bank of the River Nile, a few kilometers south of Cairo. The pyramid is the only one of the Seven wonders of the world to survive to the present day, it was built by King Khufu, known as "the Great Pyramid of Giza," around the 26 century BC.E.

This movie has a lot to recommend it. The paintings, the music, and David Hewlett's naked butt are all gorgeous! The plot, a story of redemption, forgiveness, and courage in the face of adversity is also very interesting and touching -- and it's not predictable, which is saying quite a lot about a movie in this day and age. But, the acting is mediocre, the direction is confusing, and the script is just odd. It often felt like it was trying to be a parody, but I never figured out what it was trying to be parody *of*.

I wanted to watch this , to get a inside look at the show . It told the story more like it really happened, instead of all of that drama. I loved it! It is nice to finally see an accurate documentary about a show and it's impact! I grew up watching Dukes of Hazzard with my Dad. My Dad died of lung cancer a few years ago, but I can still hear his laugh as I watch this documentary and remember all the episodes! Thanks TvOne for having the courage to produce this and thanks to Tom Wopat and John Schneider for contributing your insights!

Strange enough, shorts like this get a 10. Why? They are hilarious. This is hilarious. Notice a lot of the quirky humor. Dated and childish to toon naysayers, but they don't know what they're talking about. They got to know that cartoons aren't just for kids. The art in this is probabley the best non-Road Runner art of the 1950's Looney Tunes shorts. It's hard to come across something better than the art in "The Great Piggy Bank Robbery", although nothing ever will. This probabley runs a close 3rd or 2nd.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a horror movie. The true story of a guy who's infatuated with pictures and got scared when he identified himself unexpectedly with one of them. The unbelievable story of A GUY who got scarier when the female-hero was deluding herself as well as the male-villain. Gosh, is this what life made us be? People deluding themselves about the perfect face imagining how that face should be perfect inside? "Toto, I think we're not in Kansas anymore".

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone give me more information about her and the movie please? This is a good movie and I liked her performance. She looks very much like a Chinese girl. Do anyone know if she is Chinese? If yes, how come she speaks Hindi with a Chinese accent in the movie? Hi there, I liked this movie and her performance. She looks a Chinese girl and I would love to know if she is really from China. She looks so beautiful.

This movie is VERY LONG , but totally worth splitting up over several nights . It has an all-star cast , it is well acted and the plot line is solid . I did not want this movie to ever end and I loved every minute of it !! I would definitely recommend this to all , but be warned , it is a little graphic at times so don’t expect a light-hearted comedy . It is a drama all the way , but it is well worth the time. Great historical film based on a book about the true story of a family in India.

The show is GREAT . No words to describe it . Wonderful music . Incredible dance . The editors could have put more songs . Overall you will enjoy the show . Its a MUST WATCH . 5 Stars . I must say that it is very different and worth seeing at least once if you are Bollywood fan. Music is well integrated with dance, story and costume. I loved the dance sequences, especially the ones from 40s and 60s. Excellent choreography and stunning music. Its an amazing show. Must watch. One can see the hardwork of the artist and their dedication towards their work.

Watching this film caused quite an emotional reaction . This is what today 's documentaries are all about . It gives you information that you never heard before and never realized before . It is a very real story that shows the life of an individual and the changes that the individual brought to society. It was very touching to watch , very sad , very moving and very interesting . I was so impressed that I was not able to move away from the screen until the end of the movie . I give it a 5 stars for all of you to see .

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes , the books and the cd's . I have been to Aldershot many times to look at the locations where DAD'S ARMY WAS FILMED AND TO SEE ALL THE OTHER REAL MILITARY STUFF THERE . When the film came out I rushed to see it and I was very suprised at the way the story line was altered ! I thought it was very well made , funny , well acted and entertaining , but I didn't like the story line being altered .

Robin Hood : Men in Tights ( 1993 ) was a much needed parody from Mel Brooks . He has made his mark in Hollywood as a brilliant satirist . His films are a great source of entertainment . His films like High Anxiety , Spaceballs , Blazing Saddles and History of the world part one have been extremely successful . This film also falls into the category of satires . It is a story about Robin Hood of Nottingham. Robin Hood had been a popular figure in novels, plays, songs and movies . In Robin Hood : Men in Tights, Mel Brooks introduces his own version of Robin Hood .

GREAT, Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen.. He acts it up, perfectly. This was like watching Robim Williams as he really was and is.. It almost made me cry watching him.I had no idea that Robin was as close a friend to John Belushi as he was. The portrayal of this relationship was very good and could almost stand on it's own merits.. Very sad, what both of them went through.I really felt for both Val and Robin during his rough times.

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it. Just Before Dawn isn’t just a slasher, it has a decent story line to keep you involved and interested. There are lots of surprises and little clues that keep the viewer hooked. I love this movie and watch it often. The plot is great, and the cast is awesome. This is one of those movies that I tell everyone I know to watch it. If you are into horror movies this is one for you.

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her two children , and their lives in the suburbs . It's so witty and the dialogue so well written , it just makes you laugh out loud and makes you keep watching . Plus the characters are very like-able , and the storylines always keep you on your toes as you never know which way the next scene is going to go . I absolutely love this show... It is so funny and I love how the actors/characters are so relatable and down to earth and just normal people with normal lives.

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

America 's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense . It has a great hostess , a great panel of judges . It takes the modeling experience to a whole new level and gives viewers a glimpse at what it takes to become an America's next top model . It is very inspiring especially to people who want to pursue a modeling career . The show does a great job of giving viewers a glimpse of the life of a model and how to make it through the challenges of the modeling career . America 's next top model teaches viewers how to handle the pressure that comes along with modeling .

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing about WW1, but I was fascinated by the air battles . I saw it again a year or two later and have watched it several times since then . For a while , I thought that it wasn't being shown anymore , but recently , it was on TV . A few years ago I saw the remake starring Dennis Quaid and Meg Ryan . I enjoyed the movie, but it's not anywhere as good as the John Wayne version.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining the fast-paced action that makes this book such a blast from beginning to end. I enjoyed the story and the characters. This book was very entertaining and full of adventure. I think it could be a little confusing at first because of all of the characters and their relationships. I really liked the characters and the storyline, I loved the world that Seiler had built for his story. I did have a couple issues with the pacing though and had a hard time staying interested in the story.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites . The unsung hero of his generation . Nobody could match him for his great style , his sense of character , and his great storytelling skills . I've seen many of his films , but my all-time favorite is "My Fair Lady " . "The Philadelphia Story " runs a very close second . Here is a look back at the man and his films . . 1932- "What Price Hollywood? " . Constance Bennett . Low-budget satire on the Hollywood studio system . Co-written by Bennett's then husband-to-be Neil Simon.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , and great performances by all . The film is really good. It is set in New York but shot in England, and the British accents make everything sound so much smarter and more sophisticated than if it were played by American actors. It is full of smart, sophisticated dialog, and is more of a character drama, than a mystery story. It was made in the pre-Miranda era, and it shows, because it is a world without phones.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting an emotional response. The Reader is so beautifully filmed and acted I would like to see it made into a feature film. The Reader is an excellent short to use as the basis for discussion with any students you may teach about how to use the elements to create an effective story and to show how every element of film, no matter the length, can be used to great effect. There are plenty of great examples here that students can use as reference points for their own film work.

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? I know I miss them . That's exactly why I created this website . I want to make a change in Disney . I think they'll start making great films again if people start making an impact on them . This is the place where you can leave comments about disney's upcoming movies . What do you like about them ? What do you not like about them ? How could they make them better ? What would YOU have done differently in the film ?

I just saw this wonderfully filmed movie that captures the essence ofhigh-brow NYC, or any big city of mid-century America. The colors, thecars, the clothes and the coming of the Womens Movement. It reflects thecomf-cozy attitudes of relationships between men and women in thecorporate world. In some ways, things gave changed and in others, theyhaven't changed at all. Women still want what men have today, but theynow have all sorts of laws and equality mandates to get it for them. Inmy opinion, beautiful women will still THROW themselves at men inpursuit of thier goals!

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George. I think that was my first movie that I actually cried in the movie theater because I didn't want to leave! Sometimes I want to know how things turn out for these people. I would love to sit and have a beer with them and ask them how they are doing and if they ever met again and if they remembered how much I loved them. I'm so glad I found this movie!!! Wow. I was 29 when this movie came out.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to convince him that hunting is wrong, that he should take up vegetarianism, etc. The short ends when Bugs comes along and tricks Elmer into eating a bunch of beans. After he swallows them, Daffy scolds him : “You ate the WRONG beans, silly Elmer! Now you’ll be as healthy as a rabbit for the rest of your life!” So much for PETA. The cartoons are all available for free online if anyone is interested.

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows my love for movies and how I have improved in shooting movies in the last few years. What do you guys think? Any suggestions or critiques? I like the way you did the effects. And I think the movie was great. Hey , Thanks for watching the movie . I wanted to know what you think of the effects and the storyline . I really appreciate your comments , thanks again . I think it is great that you put this movie out there.

There are a few things in life that we ca n't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. When you are a teenager, your world is small. You have small worries and big dreams. You have little understanding of what's ahead of you in the big, wide world and you are not really in control of what happens next. You are a dreamer. And you have your whole life ahead of you. You have no idea what your future will look like and what you want to do when you grow up.

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked (no love) the movie for many reasons . I will try not to give any spoilers as I think it is more enjoyable if you go in with minimal expectations . But I can say that there are some pretty great fight scenes as expected but what you don't expect is John Wick's (keanu Reeves) bad ass skills as a gun man . There are moments that will shock and surprise the viewer (even though you should expect the unthinkable) .

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film : Who are the crazy people ? The answer become less and less obvious. The title itself is not very helpful either. Where are the ghosts that haunt these characters? We don't know. And even less : who's the mad man of the title? This is the kind of stuff that makes me like a film. For the viewer, there isn't any question of solving the riddle of the title : there is nothing to decipher. But this doesn't matter.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars ,'' it still had its own brand of satire . It was really funny watching Cartman dress up as Saddam Hussein and then beating up his imaginary wife . The whole part about him being the most evil person on the planet was also hysterical . Not quite as funny as the previous 4 episodes , but still very entertaining . I loved this episode, one of the best episodes this season. But I agree, it isn't as good as the last few episodes.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . The film opens with Ma and Pa Kettle receiving notice from the state of Pennsylvania that their home is to be condemned as an unsafe building because it was built before a certain code was enacted. They quickly pack up and are off to start over again. The Kettles stop in San Francisco in hopes of finding work to support their family and they end up getting jobs in a department store. Ma Kettle manages to accidentally destroy one of the store displays and is fired.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails . Because it was a little picture , John Ford, who made it , could afford the luxury of doing it right. I've known him a long time , and one of the things I've always admired most about him is his sense of craftsmanship , his sense of what the business is all about. We're both old-time carpenters and plumbers. I know that in making a film he's not making a statement , he's not doing anything but making a movie .

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands, a story of this nature could have led to a one-sided account of abuse and all the pain it leaves behind. This isn`t the case with this novel, however . The abuse is depicted as the vile act that it is, but the impact it has on both perpetrator and victim are all carefully examined and explained. This is a story of redemption and forgiveness. It`s the story of the human condition and the resilience that we can have when faced with our darkest nightmares .

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the flesh and the battle between them. It shows the power of good and the power of bad, and how we each have the choice to take the path that is right, and how when we choose to do good it affects those around us in ways that are sometimes unexpected. Great story and a good movie. One of the most beautiful films I have seen, and I am a very avid film goer.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . That is the color . Blue . You can read all about Blue . That is what you are going to do here . What does that color mean ? What is the whole thing ? Who is Blue ? You are going to learn all of that in the following pages of this book . We are going to go through all of it . It's not going to be a quick ride . This whole Blue thing . We will be going into all aspects of it all .

This film, released in 1951, has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50's; the cavalry needing to protect the territory from a murderous band of Indians, an officer determined to see that task through, and the men with him with various character flaws that he has to merge together into a cohesive unit. This small band must hold on to a fort located close to the Indian village until reinforcements arrive. The Indians know, all to well, that the small band is undermanned, and could be wiped out before the help comes.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of "slasher" movies in the early 1980's, that a few good ones might slip through the cracks. This is a great "rare" film from Jeff Lieberman, who insured his cult status with his memorable 1970's films "Squirm" and "Blue Sunshine".Five young people head into the Oregon mountains (this movie was actually shot on location) to do some camping and check out the deed to some land that one of them has acquired. Before long, they will predictably be terrorized by a bulky killer with an incredibly creepy wheezing laugh.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just give it a try you will love it as well . It is about a home guard unit that protects their home town from German invasion and you will be surprised at how much fun you can have watching it . It has a very comedic script and it is full of hilarious antics. I would give this show 10 stars out of 5 if i could . Hilarious, witty and very very funny. This is a great comedy show. It is very funny and witty.

Having just watched this with my mother (Who got it for Christmas) i was thrilled to find something different to the usual stuff i usually watch. All of the stories were detailed and you are able to feel strong emotion towards each character from the very beginning. Every storyline is followed through brilliantly, making you feel completely different things for every single character. The cast is amazing, my personal favourites being James Read and Lesley-Anne Down, as George Hazard and Madeline Fabray/LaMotte/Main. The whole thing is in depth and wonderful, making very compulsive viewing, i recommend it to almost everyone.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations, discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional dramas and over-the-top acting.Once in a while, movies like 15 Park Avenue come by and sweep you off your feet.The movie grasps your attention pretty early on and there is no moment to rest after that. Aparna Sen has done a wonderful job of gluing the audience to every line of the movie. The impeccable character development, "just right" amount of emotions and an enigmatic end to match it all...I have a renewed respect for Konkana Sen Sharma, who convincingly plays the schizophrenic Mithi.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats a minor point. I really like this film, there were a couple of moments when i really got the willies watching it, i thought it was a superb movie. i was disappointed when i saw the end, i thought this was a bit of a weak ending, it just sort of fizzled out. Overall a pretty good film and i am glad i spent 2 hours watching it. Hadn't even heard of this movie until the dvd was recommended to me.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just looking at the drawings. I found some more pics online with his name at the top. It made me crack up every time. If I was in charge of writing his name I'd just write "Matt" on his name tag. His name should be so obvious that you'd think someone would have thought of it before. He looks like someone who would have his name written in block letters and would wear the same shirt to work every day.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a Special Edition of this film on DVD. Even a comment from the Director on how it could be improved as some other commentators have said would be good. The DVD should have been released in the original 'scope ratio' not pan & scan, and a DTS sound track would have been good to. There is a DTS track on another DVD but this doesn't allow you to view the film properly. The Japanese DVD has a DTS audio track but only allows viewing in 4:3 pan & scan ratio.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me. I loved Orry and George's relationship so much. I was so enraptured in Orry and Madenline's love story. I am a hopeless romantic so it really got to me. I especially liked it when he first met her. I just wish he had more time with her and their baby. So you know in Book three I was so hurt that he died. I didn't really understand that because they had little time together. I just loved Patrick in this movie.

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne has condensed events , eliminated a number of characters , and generally cut the cast by about half. The first half of Wilde's novel concerns the trials of a man's passion, the second, the consequences. The play cuts Wilde 's second section in two, beginning with a brief prologue, the second half of the play consisting of Wilde's third and fourth sections. The action covers a number of years, during which time we see Dorian grow old and his portrait grow young.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it that much is because I want to BE Lorelai. She is hilarious, fun, has amazing fashion sense and is so easy to relate to. This is one of the quotes that I love and remind me everyday to live my life to the fullest and do what I love. When I was looking for this I found this website and it’s filled with more quotes that make me think. I think I will be referring to them often because they are just what I needed to hear.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much . The theme was well handled by the Director with great sensitivity . It was a film that touched the heart of all . A movie not to miss. I enjoyed the film tremendously. It is a great movie to be shared by family. Beautifully written, cast and directed. The performances were fantastic by the child actors and adults alike. I loved the story line and its execution. The characters and their development were perfect for the screen. I enjoyed it very much and would recommend to everyone to watch.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen ( mostly in English ) which has very good story and screenplay which shows a different view of marriage. And as always in her movies the actors deliver a very convincing and believable performances. Especially the lead actors - Rahul Bose and Konkona sen-sharma deliver an excellent performance especially in the last half hour. All the supporting actors also do a good job. The film is about a newly married couple who starts having conflicts in their lives and how these conflicts affects them and their relationship .

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! i wish i could be one of them ! i wish i was there with them ! Wow I just loved it. I wish they were real. I was so upset when the movie was over. What an emotional experience. The best of the three, but you need to see them in order. You'll love it. The story is so sad, and I cried many times. Great movie. You'll cry and think about it a long time.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that is why I like this movie. The actors are good. I like John C.Riley, he is always in good films. I really like his movies and that is why I watch this movie. He is a good actor, he is not like Brad Pitt or Tom cruise. That is why I am not disappointed when I go to theaters and watch this kind of movies. When I was a kid I went to theaters every weekend. I was not allowed to do that any more.

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

If you want to see a movie with nudity , sex , drugs , alcohol , brutal beating of a young boy by a older male. Then you have found a movie to watch with your teenagers . Oh I am so wrong , you can take your young impressionable children to this movie with out fear because of the rating of PG 13 . If there was any decency the movie would have been rated R . I don't think there should be ratings on movies because they have become so subjective , and are used to get parents to allow their children to see a movie that they know they shouldn't see .

Robert Altman, Nicolas Roeg, John-Luc Goddard--you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? These and other directors were obviously chosen because they have not followed the mainstream, but created it. For those that complain that they did not adhere to the original story of the opera--How often does the music in a film directly relate to what is going on in the film? It is the mood that counts. This is what I believe the directors of these movies were doing: creating a contemporary mood for old operas. For the most part they succeed wonderfully.

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks . Marjorie Main ( Ma ) steals the show as the clumsy but kind wife of Pa Kettle a poor farmer. I liked the old fashion country values in this film. The film is also notable as being the acting debut of Richard Long as Pa Kettle’s son. I did enjoy it as a light hearted comedy and look forward to the rest of the series. Labels: 1940s, Drama, Family
The Man with the Iron Fists is one of the funniest movies ever made.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . My first introduction was " Rain " , which I found quite by chance while looking for something by another artist. I bought the single for 75 cents and fell in love with the song. I had never heard two voices sing so wonderfully together. Then I saw the video for " Goodbye To Love " , and the rest is history . I purchased all their albums ( LPs and later CDs ) and followed their progress. The Carpenters were very unique , and unlike any group before them.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teenagers are on a field trip to tour the hotel. He has been killing the teenagers one by one , now it's time for the rest of them to die . I really enjoyed watching this movie , it had everything you want a killer movie to have . Kane is a smart and sadistic killer . He likes to toy with his victims , which makes the movie a lot more scary . The cast is filled with very young kids who are just about to get their fame in the acting world.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right. And when it goes wrong... I'd say that a full 3/4s of the film is great. I can even isolate the bad bit. It's everything that has to do with the romance. Everything that you need to know about it is said in the first five minutes but it drags on for about 30. I'd recommend skipping that section if you can. It does nothing except explain his exile. It should have been a minor plot point quickly thrust aside.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . We loved it ! I loved the movie as well, I was blown away by its beauty and the story is so simple yet so deep and true to all of our lives. I’m a little worried the movie might end up being too “pretty” for its own good. It’s such a delicate and lovely little film! The trailer for this film looks amazing! I just added it to my list of 2015 movies I MUST see when it comes out!

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. It’s not a film in which a story is told , a character developed , or even an emotion aroused. It’s more a mood piece about the feeling of being in a place and time you have never seen before. And it’s an exquisitely made film with a great cast. The film takes place in a future society that has decided it’s easier to destroy all of its garbage rather than recycle or dispose of it.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art to more post-modern approaches that like to dissect the play along post-colonial, feminist, gender or deconstructionist lines. The reason why Jarman's version left me fairly cold is that I didn't have a clue what he was on about. What is the underlying vision/idea/concept behind this rendering of Shakespeare? The previous reviewers do not get much further than revenge tragedy, punk show, but surely there is more to it, isn't there?

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how the Colombian mafias in the United States. His style is close to the " Scarface ", " Donnie Brasco " and films of the 80s . It is true that Colombian films are a genre of their own. Hope it will be subtitled. I don’t get it, the first film of this type that is being produced in Colombia? I don’t see what they’re so excited about?

i love this show ! it is amazing ... i can never miss an episode even if i 've already seen them . i love the chemestry between nathan and haley . they were so cute together . i am going to watch all the 6 season over again ! i wish there was season 7 . It has everything. Awesome characters. Great storylines. Very entertaining. Very relatable. Love it. Hate the ending but that’s the way it goes sometimes. I'm only on the second episode of this series but I already love it! What's not to love!

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale of an innocent chess novice who goes to his club for an important game and gets mixed up with a crowd of professional gamblers. For me, it's the chess scene that's the standout moment. One of the greatest of all chess sequences is the one in 'The Seventh Veil', in which James Mason's character tries to get Ann Todd to play against him. Unfortunately, I can't put a link up but I'm sure it'll be available on YouTube.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * THE CELL / ( 2000 ) 2005 *
THE CELL :
In this movie a killer has been on a killing spree. He kills women with a chain saw in the middle of the night while there's a thunderstorm going on and the lightning flashes. The movie then goes back and shows what lead up to the killings of the women. The main character is a serial killer who is a psychiatrist ( Jodie Foster ) who has been asked by the local authorities to go into the mind of an insane murderer.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival. I went in with the assumption that if it stars Chiwetel Ejiofor and Hilary Swank it had to be at least decent. Well, after a kind of a slow start, I was far from disappointed. In fact, I was quite pleased with the final product.I must admit the Afrikaaner and Xhosa(?) accented English of some of the actors were kind of hard to understand but like seeing "Waking Ned Devine", "Trainspotting" or any other film with heavy-accented actors I adjusted after about 15 minutes.

Fuckland is an interesting film. I personally love the Dogma movement. I wish it had lasted longer. It seems to have already died. Many critics tried their damndest to shut it down. I don't know why. It's the most interesting movement to happen in the cinematic world since the French New Wave. Besides Fuckland, I've seen the first three in the series, Festen, Idioterne, and Mifune. They were all great, Festen being a masterpiece, in my opinion. Fuckland isn't up to those others. I was just fascinated with the filmmaking.

"Please, don't kill me! I'm just an actor!" "Can you play dead?" It's difficult to describe this show. It's like a crime dramedy. Where the bad cop is an ass. Literally. What's great about the show is some of Assy's perfectly awful one-liners. Cracking out such gems as "Adios, Blimp," Assy Mcgee provides some great laughs at points. Sadly at other times, the show seems to drag along at a slow pace, making it almost hard to watch.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape , one of the bandits loses the bag containing some of the stolen gold which falls down on a rock. The other bandit, who has seen this , does not know whether the other has lost it or not and fearing that the robbery has failed, decides to return to take it back, leaving his partner alone. He returns but does not see him. When he returns , he believes his partner has already returned and that the bandit he sees is the other.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the camcorder on her parents’ relationship from the day her father returns from the hospital after being seriously injured, the director, Doug Block chronicles the life of her parents from the day they married until the death of her father 30 years later. During the span of those 30 years, viewers are able to watch her parents’ love and life unfold in an uncensored fashion. Uncensored in the fact that the camera is not only filming them, but it’s also a part of their life as a family.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a God. I hope she never stops helping the people who needs ur help. I wanted to let you know that the story of Snehal has been published in The Hindu Metroplus, yesterday. There was a very brief mention of her story on the news also. The article can be found below. http://epaper.thehindu.co.in/art/260727/Chennai/%E0%AE%BA/00000007
Aparna, I wanted to share this story with you. I came across this story few days ago.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange program at the Sorbonne for 3 months, and the program is organized by an organization called ISEP, which is a sort of consortium of about 300 American colleges. There's a total of about 25 students here, from colleges mostly in the East. So I had never met any of them prior to arriving here in Paris. I was the only one from Brown, and there's only about 25 American colleges in the whole country.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best books I have read and the miniseries was excellent. I really, really enjoyed this miniseries. It is long, but it is good. I've read the book, but I was glad that they changed some things in the miniseries. I thought the characters were all very well cast. There were several changes from book to miniseries, but overall, I was very pleased. If you enjoy historical fiction, this series is a must!

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule at that moment. It ended up surprising me in a good way. I found it to be funny, and not just in that "mildly amusing" kinda way, I found it to be genuinely funny. I was also impressed by the performances of the actors and actresses. It had a very naturalistic feel, which I appreciated. I was also surprised at how much depth was in the characters and how well developed the relationships between the characters were.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing , good acting from the leads ( especially the female lead ), and a great story! This is a very enjoyable film from RKO Saint Pictures. If you have enjoyed any of the other Saint films so far, this one is certainly not to be missed. It was great to see the return of the Saint's sidekick in the person of Renee Godfrey as Pat Paget. Godfrey is well remembered from her days at Universal in the 1940's.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

First love . Teenage love . We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the movies made it look. Love can be painful at that age, especially the first one. It hurts when you have to break up. You think you will never recover but you do. You can’t wait to fall in love again because you are so naive. I love reading books about it because I think it’s something we all have experienced at one point of our lives. Love Me Back was a very interesting story. I liked the style it was written.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during one of my breaks at work . I saw the commercial and was thinking it looked like it might be interesting to watch . I got home early that night ( which is very rare for me ) . I was able to watch the pilot . I've been hooked on it since . It's one of the best shows on television , it's just a shame more people haven't caught on to it .I've got friends and family hooked on it now .

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , horror fans were going to want more and more gore and violence.
