With this in mind, it's no surprise that the Italian horror film industry would take notice and try to keep up. While the Italian horror films from the 60 's - 80 's have their fair share of gore themselves, they're often not as graphic as their more American counterparts. Italian horror movies tend to rely more on the supernatural or horror fantasy to get their point across and not necessarily on the blood, gore, and guts.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent, unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters. In the same way I loathed Fargo on first viewing, then realized I was still thinking about it days later and enjoying it somehow, I liked Nurse Betty a lot more the day after I saw it. Hard to understand, harder to explain. As others have said, it's quite forced in many ways, but that seems to be part of what makes it so striking.Fair job by Greg Kinnear, great work from Morgan Freeman (although I worry that he's being stereotyped as the principled villain).

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, they blame him for his reasons. Feeling guilty, Peck goes on an almost impossible task of defending a fort, where they are outnumbered by the Indians. Peck chooses for this mission soldiers which he considers to be the scum of the earth and the actors that play these soldiers, Ward Bond, Lon Chaney Jr., Neville Brand among others, are excellent. The script is derived from a novel by Charles Marquis Warren who was a specialist in westerns, as a writer, director and producer.

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early eighties. For some reason I always had the image of Alice in a dress and carrying a white rabbit around her neck . Of course she was also the girl who got smaller and larger. The only thing Alice in Wonderland did for me was that I never ever wanted to see another film of a book written by Lewis Carroll. And that is the thing about movies based on books  we often feel they are only for people who havent read the books yet.

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager , but I am glad to say it still stands up as a great piece of film making . The special effects are very good indeed and I think that the storyline was pretty innovative for the time ( 1980’s ) and is still not far removed from the themes that are around today. If I were to say that this was a film that was inspired by Jaws then I would be lying , but it is a film which I think is inspired by the success of the Jaws films .

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when the wagon comes to it's first stop, only 70 000 persons who are waiting to see if Sweden would accept more refugees. In January the answer came. Sweden was willing to accept 7500 more people, but not the Germans who has been there already for a year. No, now we want to get some people out from Germany, the government said. Thus a refugee transport from Germany to Stockholm started for the last time.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that 's been released lately . It was funny , creepy , touching , scary and the list just goes on . I've never seen a movie like this and i know that this movie will be one of those movie that you want to see over and over again . You can't really say that you are a true movie fan and not seen this movie. It's so creative and i'm pretty sure that people who have seen it can't really tell you what it is about because it was so creepy but still so hilarious.

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film. I really enjoyed watching the film and i'd rate it 5/5, although i do feel as though the plot could have been improved and made a little more gripping and dramatic. The film is based on 2 main characters, a young boy called David who is on the search for his father and a replicant (artificial human who has been genetically engineered by the humans) called Roy who is hunting down 8 replicants who stole a set of special police files.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning this particular movie and the reviewer stated the same exact words that I used to describe this film , but I saw this movie several years ago . I remember it so distinctly I'm almost sure it had to be my very first viewing . So I was surprised to read someone else make the same exact remarks I had made about it years before . I believe this to have been his second film after D.O.A. He made it from 1944-48.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off. For the first solo adventure of the Kettles a new writing team and director is introduced. Leonard Goldstein, associate producer of The Egg and I, was producer of The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle. With many of the characters played by the same actors and actresses the focus from the MacDonalds to the Kettles works very well. There is a reference to Ma beating Birdie Hicks for first prize at the fair for her quilt, an import scene in The Egg and I.

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best defines me this year is " REFLECTION". A lot of reflection has taken place over the years and the last 8 months has been no different. This year I can say with full confidence that i am more clear about what it is that I really want. I am in the middle of a huge transformation. A transformation that I am very proud of and excited about. So 2017 , bring it! I am ready ! I feel so good and I feel so me.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is now considered by many to be one of the most important Blue Planet DVDs in years. You see, I'm sure you have your favorites (and you'll see that in my descriptions below), but to my way of thinking there is something for EVERYONE here on this 4 disc set. The most important thing of course is the footage itself. In the last ten years of diving I have not had a more incredible time underwater than I did during this filming.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most of the people in the theater knew nothing about this movie , nor cared for that matter . This is the kind of film that I'd take a date to , who was very smart but knew very little of cinema history . I have always been an avid film buff , and have seen most of the films that are considered "Classics" , even though I'm not much of a fan of musicals or romances ( which this film falls into ).

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now, so that I could turn my attention to reviewing the shows from the 1950s that they made for the BBC and that I have recently purchased. This 1993 BBC 1 series was originally shown in 1993 on BBC One. The 2 disc DVD set that I recently bought came out in 2009. The series had 7 episodes, each 30 minutes. The first 4 episodes were repeated on BBC 2 in the UK in January 2005, and again in November 2009.

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures were amazing, as well as the scenery and of course, the actors and the story . I really liked the story . I think this is a great documentary to see . For all the people who are curious to see this kind of films . If you want to watch a beautiful film, then watch it , but if you want a movie to see , it 's better to stay home . This is a good example of documentary filmmaking, but it won't win any prizes for creativity .

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

`` The Honkers '' is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time . When we were shooting , everyone wanted to do what Pickens was doing , he could have been the leader of the film , but he never had any attitude , he was always nice and easy going , he is the best , the best . '' In my last letter I wrote about two of the cast members who had been in the original stage play, Slim Pickens (who had won an Oscar for Dr. Strangelove, just two years earlier) and Robert Vaughn, whom I've always had a bit of a 'thing' for.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and to think about what they've always known to be true but maybe don't live by. The acting was solid and the characters all likable. I hope this film finds a bigger audience and I'd be interested to see what the writer/director does next. This was an awesome movie. It was so good, and I hope you get to see it as well. Fantastic film. This is a must see. I would see this again, and hope that others would too.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice and the 95-minute version once . That said , I would still like to say a few words on it . Here's the short version : This is the best version available and it is still worth watching for the performances . The movie begins with an introduction by James Earl Jones who explains what "The Little Foxes" were about . The 1941 movie , starring Bette Davis , was about an immoral family in the south in the early 20th century who took advantage of an old family friend .

I Love this movie ! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie , but for me it was ! It is a great movie for any age , I know a lot of guys who like it too . There is a lot of really cool action and it is a great movie ! I agree it is a movie for any age. I like it as well, I think it’s one of the better movies out there but I also know some people would say it is overrated and some people could say they just don’t like it.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy ( Charles Martin Smith ) to take their wagonload of supplies to the mission at San Bernardino. In the middle of the desert, they're attacked and killed by Apache. Travis and Sandy survive the attack, but are left with no supplies and no destination. While trying to make a go of it in the desert, Sandy and Travis find themselves caught between an Indian and Mexican army in the middle of a war for power and control of the land.

Most of these reviews are dead on, so I'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of questions I've seen on here.While the characters seem and look young (hence the controversy), the actor/actress themselves were 17 and 18 at the time and so obviously over the 16 barrier. Here in the USA, that's still somewhat controversial but the simplicity and innocence of the film does much to offset it.I'm sorry not to have seen more by Sean; in this movie at least his expressions are demonstrative and obvious; you know exactly what the character is feeling whether he's angry, afraid, or confused.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in this one is of a penguin who is holding a little sign that says “ I do not want to have a penguin on my car” . Then we get to see a couple of cartoon cats getting married . These two love birds get married in the back seat of a Volkswagen that has been converted into a mobile wedding chapel on wheels. We then see a cartoon pig who says that he is marrying a pig too .

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm , wit , and charm . At age 16 Lorelai is pregnant by her wealthy boyfriend who dumps her for being too wild . She leaves home and moves to Stars Hollow . Lorelai is a single mother to Rory , a beautiful girl who at 16 goes off to private school . I can't watch TV without Rory . Her sarcastic humor makes me giggle all the time ! She loves books and reading . So do I . Rory makes me laugh every time she is on screen with her sarcasm and quick witted comebacks .

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

I did n't personally know Karen Carpenter , nor , Richard for that matter , so I must go by the recordings of them , and by those who knew them best . I 'm not surprised by Richard 's actions , as he was very close to Karen and probably saw things that others didn 't see . When one is a performer they have to put on a persona that the fans want to hear , and see . That's what Karen did . I know many performers who are not the people they appear to be offstage , just as I know the opposite .

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into the usual plotline. That's how I would describe 'Soul'. There's nothing new or revolutionary on offer but there's also nothing to offend - a nicely-made movie that's pleasant to watch and not too challenging. A couple of sequences are a little too over-the-top in their use of special effects but that's the only serious problem. This film is a remake of a film of the same name made 34 years earlier, but the only real link is the title.

King of Queens is comic genius. Kevin James, whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny, Leah Remini who plays Doug's wife Carrie is incredibly hot ( # 19 on Stuff magazine's hottest 102 woman list ), and very funny. The true magic of the show However is the scenes with Jerry Stiller, they are the funniest in the show. Jerry, a comic genius, plays Carrie's father, Arthur Spooner, whom lives in Doug and Carrie's always cold basement. I must admit that I never watched this show until this year, 2006.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making the documentary for the father's sake , so that the memory of his beloved one will be preserved in this unique way. In an intimate, yet distant way , we witness the lives of these elderly people who are struggling with their lives in their last years. We are witnessing what is considered the ' last days of humanity' , as the father says, before death comes . "Farewell Mum " is an extremely sensitive film , because of its intimacy.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute film with some amusing jokes and characters. This is certainly a good film, but it seems that it is lacking in something. There is no real story in Chomps. I mean it is there, but I never really understood it, or was able to figure out what the storyline was about, or why it was important. Chomps is about 3 kids who are best friends and go on a trip to visit their Uncle Chompers.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan, I really loved this film (although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired!) and agree with many of the comments, that certain areas of her life were absent or not touched on. Whatever - it leaves your curiosity well and truly unsatisfied, so off I went to discover more. I must recommend a book by Ray Coleman - Carpenters - The Untold Story. The book is an intelligent read and unlike the film, is 'real' and down to earth. I hope you enjoy it. I remember Cynthia Gibb from her days in Fame and Gypsy.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official. Then he's a fugitive on the run. They later blow up his house and then he finally commits suicide. Seems like they should have just made it a film for a more mature audience or made it more family friendly.This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official.

` Skenbart ' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Netherlands in years. It tells the story of Sander Schutte, an ordinary office worker. He is a bachelor with a small but comfortable apartment. Nothing unusual about him. But, there is. At school, Sander had a problem. His hair would not stay still. So, to solve that, he decided to cut it short. But, as the years went on, the problem got worse. So, Sander grew a mullet, to solve that problem.

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

As I was reading through the comments, I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was "not very profound." I have to disagreethis has to be one of the deepest and most thought-provoking films I've ever seen. Yes, the acting and the music were excellent; they have been praised over and over in the reviews. However, I also praise the heart of the movie. It resonates with deep meaning and feelingit is a story of redemption. It is about two very different and very flawed characters, beaten down by life but too strong to lie down and die.

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

SPOILERS AHEAD------------------------- Mel has got it going on. From the opening credits to the ending credits this movie has straight laughs. Dave Chappel shows why he is a comedic force. Cary Eewes carries the movie most of the time, but the supporting cast fills in strong when the plot is drawn away from Robin Hood. Right from the beginning this movie proclaims it's self not to be taken seriously. If you took a time machine and gave the characters thoughts of modern day antics you would get this movie.

Honestly, when I went to see this movie at the Rave theater in Plainfield Indiana, I did not expect much. I went to this movie only because I figured hey, it's a WWE movie it'll be good for a laugh. Then I sat down and watched it and saw why they chose Glen Jacobs (Kane) to play Jacob Goodnight. He is probably one of the freakiest guys on the big screen (much worse in my opinion than Freddy or Jason) and has one big advantage to other movies that attracts me to a horror movie.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student life of engineering college and takes you on a whirlwind ride of fun, frolic and adventure ! Ashwin and Vicky are the best of friends who do everything together and love partying. The two have an uncanny knack for getting out of trouble and are quite a pair when it comes to the antics. But they are about to meet their match with the entry of Sanam, the new girl in town who is ready to give the boys a lesson or two in how to party.

As Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del (Aaron Eckhart) being murdered by the vengeful hitmen Charlie and Wesley (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), her bruised sense of reality becomes totally immersed in the fantasy world of her favorite soap opera. In a state of complete denial and delusion, Betty escapes both physically and mentally from her unsatisfied, small town life to search for "Dr. David Ravell" (Greg Kinnear), the handsome and loving hero of "A Reason to Love", a soap opera set in a hospital and produced in Los Angeles.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty Ann Davis and her daughter were our favorite actors in the flick . They were both great . I loved the scene where the mom and the girl were sitting and talking in the car . The mom's face looked like she just got the worst news in the world and the daughter looked worried too . I'll say no more . Watch it to see what happens to them after that and if there was some truth to the end .

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with the others I will be listing. It was found in an old house after the owners had passed away , this was the time when Egyptian taste was popular and I guess these items were passed on down through the years , and as they have not been used much , I thought I would take them back to the land of the Pharaohs to be enjoyed again ! Condition : There is some wear to the base , but nothing to effect the figure , see photo.

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film's main achievements. When you hear a vague outline of the story  Erasmus students of mixed nationalities sharing a flat in Barcelona  you predict a collection of Euro-stereotypes in a farcical tangle. Pas du tout! In fact, it's a finely judged comedy about a young Frenchman, Xavier, trying to make sense of human relationships. There are some excellently observed minor roles (the arrogant French neurologist, the insufferably irrepressible brother of the English girl, Xavier's forlorn mother) and some fine visual humour, especially in the opening scenes mocking the bureacratic complexity of the application procedure.

I 'm absolutely disgusted this movie is n't being sold . All who love this movie should email Disney and say this is unacceptable. It will be the first time I have ever done this but if it works I will be happy to say I had a small part in getting it. Thank you . JUST GIVE US THE MOVIE IN BLU-RAY FOR CHRIST SAKES!!!!! This is a GREAT family film and we love it. We have seen it several times. We really wish they would just release the movie on DVD and Blu Ray and be done with it.

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old , ( having an existing interest in such films ) , as part of a school assembly where a group of older students showed their own home made films . I do not know who the students were that made this film , but I thank them from my heart to this day for the joy and inspiration their efforts provided . I was not the only one to be moved by this work , as the whole audience of over 50 kids sat completely entranced .

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, the first two thirds are quite good . The story and acting are both very good , I am sure that most of you have seen this , but for those who havn't . I can recommend it . I've not seen this in years. Will have to rent it. I'm in the process of watching 3 movies in a row that are set in the late 1970s: "Rocky", "Convoy", and "The Longest Yard".

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bum cheeks and around her bum hole. It was also brilliant to see Alan's bum going up and down like a fiddler's elbow later on in the film.Alan was tough as hell in it like when he got annoyed and pushed the four eyed wimp onto the sofa.I've been laughing for days about the cut throat razor bit. The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series that I've ever seen . If it wasn't a 1989 release, I'd say it's a must own. The Blue Planet is the best nature/documentary series in the history of TV. I'd recommend the boxed set to everyone, regardless of the age. It is amazing how much is packed into each of the 6 double sized dvds, with some of the most stunning scenery and footage of wildlife you'll ever see, but the most amazing feat is that each episode is only 40 mins long!

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in the early 1980's. We went to an arcade and he saw this movie being played on a VHS machine. It looked and sounded so awesome, so we watched the whole thing! Was this the first time a movie was "broken up" for a home video? It seems like it, or at least one of the earliest. Anyways, here's a brief review:
The film is about three young people who are out on a road trip when the car breaks down.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's nakedness all make for an interesting hour and a half . I do not wish to speak for anyone else but for me I really did not care for it . Perhaps I would have liked it better had I been drinking something stronger than cola . I'm a little sorry it wasn't in theaters as it may have been interesting to see the audience watching it . I'll have to see it again on video and that way I can watch the movie without any distractions .

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later turned into a stage musical , which I performed in the Theatre Royal Haymarket in London , 1961 . The Film was made at Shepperton Studios , London in 1959 . Actor Sam Kelly in the TV series ``The Army Game '' , 1958 . With my wife , Joan Sims in the stage musical production of `` Dead Rail '' in 1962 . Sam , my character in the stage musical `` Dead Rail '' , which opened at the Theatre Royal Haymarket , London , 1961 .

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made is the gorgeous and glamorous The Prisoner Of Zenda (1937) starring Ronald Colman, David Niven and Douglas Fairbanks Jr . This is the film that brought the phrase “the Ruritanian romance” into our everyday vocabulary, and the film that created the public image of Prince Rudolf of Ruritania as a dashing cavalier, a swashbuckling hero, a man who would do anything for his friends, and above all the very model of a gentleman.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to take a look for it on YouTube. Took me 4 years to finally watch this episode after it was posted on YouTube in July 11, 2007! Now that I found it I'm gonna post it on the blog so everybody can take a look at it. I hope you enjoy it as much I do. Now I'm just gonna have to look for the rest of the episodes to watch them and see if they are as entertaining as this one.

This is a great concert which featured the best songs of the band's 30 year career. Lee, Lifeson, and Peart were animated and fun on stage and delivered a great show. That being said, I think the audio recording was botched at the mixing console and/or through the miking process. This is not the fault of the boys however. They even mentioned that the show was setup last-minute, so the band and their crew obviously did their best. They just shouldn't have put the show out for public consumption.

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of US citizens to movie culture and how they perceive their country and their place in the world. It's certainly true that Americans love the movies and the idea that the movies are an important part of their culture. It's a bit hard to get away from in the United States and there is a tendency to go a bit overboard about it at times. But it is true that in a way the movies do play a key role in the culture of the United States.

A remarkable film , bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much , much younger. It is the first time in decades that I have been so excited about the possibility of film making and, as a member of the audience, I am deeply grateful for having had the opportunity to see this extraordinary piece. Congratulations! Thank you and good luck! Wonderful script, wonderfully acted by a terrific cast. The way the director brought the characters to life through their eyes. It felt as if I was right there with the characters.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a nightmare. It was not a very good one either, but it was my fault for not reading up on him or listening to my girlfriends opinion. She had told me it was going to be bad and that was it. I didn’t want to listen and when I got there I couldn’t believe how much I was going to see him for such a small amount of money. I had to go as I had been waiting so long.

Based on Mika Waltari 's Book , This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color , beautiful costumes and wonderful sets . It tells a story set in 1500's India , in the court of Emperor Akbar as he rules his vast empire . It stars Dilip kumar in the lead role with Bina Rai as the love interest. A classic film of the Golden Era of Bollywood , with great music , wonderful acting , stunning locations , a story that will hold your attention through and through , this movie is a timeless classic .

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait a while to catch shows I like on DVD. This is just my humble opinion. This is one of my all time favorite television shows . I love everything about this show. It's characters, storyline, settings and cast. It has elements of the old Starsky & Hutch with the buddy cop/buddy cop dynamics. It's like Starsky & Hutch in the future. It's fun and I love it. If you haven't watched it I'd recommend that you try and catch it on DVD or something .
